Article.Description: Yamato Holdings has reached a basic agreement with the US helicopter manufacturer Bell Helicopter to develop the fuselage, and Yamato has developed a container for loading cargo. (Machine Translated from Chinese)
Full_Article:
According to "Nihon Keizai Shimbun" reported on October 12, Japan's Yamato Holdings began to jointly develop unmanned transport aircraft with US companies. This "flying truck" has a speed of about 160 kilometers per hour and can transport up to 450 kilograms of cargo. It will be commercialized by the mid-2020s while paying attention to the legal perfection of the Japanese government to avoid air collisions. The Japanese logistics industry is facing a serious shortage of manpower. Now it is formally taking action and hopes to overcome this problem through technical strength.

Yamato Holdings has reached a basic agreement with the US helicopter manufacturer Bell Helicopter to develop the fuselage, and Yamato has developed a container for loading cargo. After the conveyor has risen vertically to a certain height, the posture of the body is changed to the horizontal direction when moving, and the speed is generated.

Yamato envisages not only distributing small items to customers' families, but also transporting goods at medium and long distances. The container for loading the cargo is planned to be smoothly transferred to a vehicle such as a truck. The company will conduct a test flight to the fuselage capable of loading 30 kilograms of cargo and a total length of about 1.5 meters by August 2019 to check for problems.

The logistics industry is facing a shortage of manpower, and there is a trend in the increase in the cost of express delivery and the conversion of transportation methods from trucks to ships and railways. As truck drivers age, they will face even more serious problems in the future. In this case, Yamato has stepped up its development of a new generation of transportation methods.

To be practical, it is necessary to solve problems such as safety and noise prevention. Avoiding legal construction such as air collision is also a problem that needs to be solved in the future. The Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry and the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism launched a government-civilian consultation on “flight cars”, including logistics, in August, and began discussions on rules and regulations to ensure safety and operational management. The road map will be launched in the year of 2018, and the legal construction will be promoted with the goal of putting it into practical use in the 2020s.

Heading: Huabin Tianxing Navigation Resumes Flight Activities in Beijing Area
Article.Description: On October 9, Beijing Huabin Tianxing General Aviation Co., Ltd. announced that it had agreed to lift the restrictions on the navigation of Huabin Star by the North China Bureau of Civil Aviation, and resumed its operation in Beijing. A Bell 429 /B-70QC helicopter crashed on July 30, 2018 when it was carried out from Beijing Miyun Airport to Chaoyang District Sunhe Station. The helicopter was destroyed and four people were injured. During the accident investigation, the suspension of all flight activities of Huabin Star in the Beijing area was suspended. (Machine Translated from Chinese)
Full_Article:
Venture capital is an investment method that provides financial support to start-ups andobtains their shares. Venture capital can realize the close integration of capital andtechnology and promote the rapid industrialization of technology. It is an important catalyst for the operation of innovative ecosystems in developed countries in the US andEurope. It promotes the rapid development of high-tech industries represented by information and biotechnology, and cultivates apples. Many famous high-tech companies such as Google and Intel. Since 2015, Safran, Airbus, Loma, Boeing and other international aviation manufacturing giants have set up venture capital departments, investing in small start-ups engaged in cutting-edge technology development to capture innovation opportunities from outside the industry. Recently, venture capital activities of various companies have shown signs of further acceleration. In June 2018, Airbus andBoeing invested in two and three start-ups, respectively, both hitting a new monthly high, and Loma announced that it would double its venture capital fund.

I. Analysis of the motivation of foreign aviation manufacturers to carry out venture capital

Compared with the information industry where venture capital is prevalent, the aviationindustry has the characteristics of high threshold, high risk and high investment. It is subject to strict safety supervision and is therefore conservative in major investment in aircraft manufacturing. Today, with the rapid development of emerging technologies andindustries, subversion, cross-border, integration and penetration have become new trends. Frontier subversive technologies such as artificial intelligence, hypersonic, andintelligent manufacturing will open up a new pattern for the development of aviationtechnology in the future, transforming the traditional Scientific research production mode. At the same time, the pattern of technological innovation is also undergoing profound changes. Innovative small enterprises with unique technological advantages have emerged in large numbers. Large high-tech companies such as Google and Intel have eroded the territory of traditional aviation manufacturers through products such as drones and all-electric aircraft. In response to the challenges, foreign large-scale aerospacemanufacturing companies are focusing on the new round of key areas of technology andindustrial change, strengthening the ability to identify, acquire and transform emerging technologies, and using venture capital as a way to tap external innovation, seek technology or disruptive innovation in business models. An important means of opportunity to seize the opportunities for future development.

2. Overview of venture capital investment of major foreign aviation manufacturers

Since 2015, venture capital has become popular among large aviation manufacturers. Aviation manufacturing giants such as Safran, Airbus, Boeing and Loma have established venture capital institutions.

1. Safran Ventures

Safran Group established a corporate venture capital company in May 2015, andinvested 50 million euros in initial funding within three years to provide funding for start-ups that have developed breakthrough, disruptive technologies or new business models to “help the peak response”. The challenges facing the aerospace, defense and security markets reflect Safran's corporate strategy based on innovation and change. Areas of interest include advanced materials, robotics, new manufacturing processes, network sensors and their data analysis, machine/vehicle systems for aircraft and other vehicles, and Internet of Things solutions. So far, a total of five companies have been invested (list), with security services, augmented reality, additive manufacturing, computer chips and photonic solutions.

2. Airbus Ventures

The Airbus Group established a venture capital firm in Silicon Valley in May 2015 andestablished offices in Paris, France and Tokyo, Japan. With an initial investment of US$150 million, it invests in “disruptive innovation” technology on a global scale. His areas of focus include smart manufacturing and smart factories, urban air traffic andautomated aircraft, artificial intelligence, new energy and aerospace. So far, a total of 17 companies have been invested (list), and their main businesses include smart manufacturing, industrial software, quantum computing, airspace management, autonomous systems, smart sensors, Internet of Things, drones, space debris detection and protection.

3. Loma Ventures

Loma set up a venture capital firm in June 2016 with a focus on autonomous systemsand robotics, network security, space technology, advanced communications andsensors, underwater technology, data analysis, artificial intelligence and machine learning, and next generation. Avionics, advanced materials and manufacturing, energy and power systems. So far, a total of five companies have been invested (list), with the main business being artificial intelligence, autonomous systems, industrial software, advanced communications and sensors, and unmanned submersibles. In June 2018, affected by the large-scale tax cuts of the US federal government, Loma announced that it would double its venture capital fund to reach $200 million.

4. Boeing Horizon X Ventures

Boeing established HorizonX Venture Capital in April 2017. It has more than 30employees and is divided into three groups: venture capital , new business anddisruptive. They are responsible for finding start-ups and providing funds. The market introduces new capabilities, introduces existing capabilities into new markets, and looks for opportunities outside of traditional commerce. The company has an average annual investment of tens of millions of dollars. So far, it has invested in 14 companies (list). Its main business involves hypersonic, advanced materials, additive manufacturing, augmented reality, satellite communications, driverless, artificial intelligence. , hybrid, cargo drones and other fields.

Third, the main characteristics of foreign aviation manufacturers venture capital

In view of the recent venture capital activities of Boeing, Airbus, Loma and Safran, the four major aviation manufacturers have the following characteristics.

1. Investment targets focus on high-tech, high-potential start-ups

All aviation manufacturers focus on investing in start-ups with new technologies, new materials or new services, high-tech and high-growth characteristics, and their scientific and technological achievements are mostly in the early stage of the transition from laboratories to industrialization. In addition, the management team and management process of the investment object are also important considerations.

2. The investment field is closely linked to the future aviation business upgrade

The main investment fields of various aviation manufacturers can be summarized into six aspects: First, technologies that represent the future development direction of aviationtechnology, such as electric aircraft, hypersonic flight, and autonomous systems; second, technologies related to improving production efficiency, such as additive manufacturing. , augmented reality, smart factories, etc.; third, key basic products, such as advanced materials, special chips, smart sensors, industrial software, etc.; Fourth, related technologies to enhance user experience, such as air Internet, satellite communications, Internet of Things, etc.; Future air traffic vehicles, such as flying taxis, cargo drones, etc.; six are new business models, such as Airbus to explore helicopter-like on-demand service similar to Uber . These areas are closely related to the core business development of aerospace manufacturers.

3. Investment mode follows the mode of VC investment

All aviation manufacturers' venture capital companies operate in accordance with the modern high-tech industry venture capital investment mode, follow the risk investment approach, and join the companies in the lead, investment or investment mode, participate in the start-up A, B or C rounds. Financing, a single investment amount is in the range of hundreds of thousands to millions of dollars.

4. Investment objectives are more focused on the benefits of future development

Venture capital does not aim at controlling the company, but gains profits through equity appreciation. Compared with general risk capital, which values ??short-term high profits and high returns, aerospace manufacturers pay more attention to benefiting from the future development of technology, and establish long-term strategic partnership with investment objects, through its strong research and technical resources, rich Engineering experience and a large supply chain system drive the development of start-ups.

5. Management mode chooses according to its own situation

First, the affiliation of the venture capital departments of various aviation manufacturers is different. The venture capital companies of Boeing, Loma and Safran belong to the subordinate departments or subsidiaries of the group. The Airbus venture capital company is an independent venture capital fund with independent operations. right. The second is to select management based on actual conditions on the premise of emphasizing specialization. Airbus, Loma and Safran hired experienced professional venture capitalists as CEOs, while Boeing appointed the CEO of Insitu UAV, which it acquired, to lead the venture capital arm.

6. Investment decisions are supported by professional institutions

Due to the uncertainties faced by start-ups, the project failure rate and market elimination rate are high, and venture capital must be accompanied by a large investment risk. In this regard, each company's venture capital department has professional institutions orbusiness departments to provide decision support for its venture capital activities. For example, the Airbus A3 Silicon Valley Technology and Business Innovation Center is responsible for providing professional technical knowledge and investment risk assessment for the investment activities of Airbus Venture Capital.

Fourth, the revelation suggestion

The intensive venture capital activities of foreign aviation manufacturing giants in recent years reflect that the strategic competition for future technological innovation is unprecedentedly fierce, and they are trying to maintain their leading position in the rapid transformation of aviation. At present, venture capital is very active in China's Internet +, sharing economy, big data, cloud computing, new media and other industries, and has become an important catalyst for China's new economic development, and continues to extend to traditional industries. In line with the development trend at home and abroad, China's aviation industry should also pay attention to the application of venture capital in the industry.

First, aiming at the long-term development needs of aviation weapons and equipment in the future, aiming at the development trend of aviation technology, and exploring the use of venture capital as an important means to promote the deep development of military-civilian integration, establish a diversified technology investment mechanism, and build an open collaborative innovation system. Combining risky investment means with excellent social innovation resources to make up for their own research power can not cover the shortcomings of cutting-edge subversive technological innovation hotspots, strategically deploy future aviation technology, products and business models, andfoster new economic growth points.

Second, considering the differences in innovation environments at home and abroad, domestic venture capital should pay more attention to business model innovation andtechnology-driven start-ups. In the current situation where China's technology-driven start-ups are difficult to compete with the US and Europe in terms of quantity and quality, they should actively plan with a global perspective and invest in foreign outstanding innovation resources within the scope permitted by domestic and foreign policies andregulations. If conditions are met, participate in financing activities of foreign technology start-ups with international aviation manufacturers.

Third, while improving strategic vision and market vision, we attach great importance to risk management and risk assessment. At present, domestic venture capital has promoted a bubble tendency under the continuous high capital boom, and start-ups are mixed. We should carefully analyze and carefully identify the potential value of innovative SMEs and their scientific and technological achievements, and select investment objects that have unique technological advantages, high growth potential and synergy with the core business of the aviation industry, reduce investment risks and improve investment returns.

Heading: The Italian Helicopter AW189 Has Arrived at the Pavilion and Its Worth Is as High as 200 Million Yuan.
Article.Description: The 200 million Italian AW189 helicopter was transported into Hall 4 of the National Convention and Exhibition Center.The AW189 is the latest high-performance super mid-size twin-engine helicopter with a maximum take-off weight of 8.6 tons and two GE CT7-2E1 high-power turboshaft engines with FADEC. (Machine Translated from Chinese)
Full_Article:
The 200 million Italian AW189 helicopter was transported into Hall 4 of the National Convention and Exhibition Center. The process was “hard and domineering”. News reporter Yu Kai was given a picture of the respondent as the first China International Import Expo smart and high-end equipment exhibition area aerospace fine The AZ189, the most expensive exhibit in the sub-district area, was successfully transported to the National Exhibition Center at Hall 4.1H on the morning of October 28th.

The inter-American people who brought the aircraft to Shanghai to participate in the news (www.thepaper.cn) revealed that in order to ensure the safe transportation process, three cars were dispatched this morning last night to load the AW189. Large logistics vehicles serve as “escorts”. On the morning of October 28th, the most expensive helicopter finally passed the 4.5km high National Exhibition Center West Square, slowly and smoothly entered the 4.1H pavilion, and began the final assembly and installation work.

The AW189 is the latest high-performance super mid-size twin-engine helicopter with a maximum take-off weight of 8.6 tons and two GE CT7-2E1 high-power turboshaft engines with FADEC. The cabin can be used for up to 20 people, with a maximum cruising speed of 287 km/h, maximum fuel consumption of over 2 tons and maximum range of over 1000 km. At the same time, the AW189 is equipped with a vitrified, integrated and open avionics system that greatly enhances situational awareness, effectively reducing pilot workload and optimizing the efficiency of performing tasks.

According to a person from Leonardo Helicopter, the AW189 meets the latest Federal Aviation Administration and the European Aviation Safety Agency's 29 most stringent safety standards, and has the world's strongest 50-minute final drive dry-running capability. It fully guarantees the safety requirements for its search and rescue operations and offshore oil operations.

Up to now, AW189 has sold more than 150 aircraft worldwide, nearly 60 of which are in active service, with a cumulative total of more than 35,000 flight hours. It is the most successful super medium-sized commercial helicopter in the world. AW189's operators include offshore oil operators Bristo, ERA, CHC, Bel-Air, Weststar, VNH, etc., while AW189 performs maritime search and rescue missions in the UK and the Malvinas Islands, in South Korea, Tokyo, Japan. Malaysia performs fire fighting tasks.

The Italian Leonardo helicopter AW189 flew from Malaysia to Shenzhen, China on October 17 and began to embark on the final “journey” to Shanghai. Shenzhen is the first stop for transportation to Shanghai. After that, it stopped and stopped for several stops, replenished fuel, and finally arrived at the designated place in Shanghai, and then checked it to the exhibition area.

Since the National Convention and Exhibition Center, where the main venue of the Import Expo is located, is a no-fly zone, the AW189 helicopter will be used for land transfer. It will fly from Shenzhen to Shanghai Gaodong Helicopter Airport and then fly from Gaodong Airport to Shanghai Hawke. The Pacific Business Aviation Center will then be disassembled and re-assembled in the Progress Hall.

The Leonardo helicopters in Italy have three models to participate in the import fair in Shanghai, namely AW189, AW139 and AW119Kx. The latter two models have been sold in China, so the exhibits are also much more convenient to transport than the AW189. After Wuxi flew to Shanghai, it transferred to the transportation progress hall; the other was in Shanghai, and the transit to the transportation progress hall.

According to relevant Interamerican sources, in addition to the AW189 arrived today, another model of the AW139 helicopter will be loaded at Shanghai Gaodong Helicopter Airport at around 14:30 pm on October 28th. If the loading is progressing smoothly, the evening will be It will also arrive at the Qingpu National Convention and Exhibition Center.At the same time, the Leonardo helicopters, including the AW189, will be statically displayed at the Immortal Company booth at the Import Expo from November 5th to 10th.

Heading: Airbus Will Participate in the 2018 China Air Show With Innovative Products and Services
Article.Description: A series of Airbus helicopter models will be on display at the Airbus booth, including the H130, a lightweight single-engine helicopter in the small squirrel family, the latest generation of Airbus helicopter H160 and a new generation of super mid-size helicopters developed and manufactured by 50:50 H175. (Machine Translated from Chinese)
Full_Article:
Civil Aviation Resource Network October 31, 2018 News: Airbus will participate in the China International Aerospace Exhibition in Zhuhai from November 6th to 11th, demonstrating its innovative products that meet the needs of current and future aerospace industry in various fields and service.

The Airbus booth is located at the H4CA booth in the main exhibition hall, and the profile models of Airbus' latest wide-body aircraft A330 neo and A350-1000 will be exhibited here. The A330neo, equipped with the latest wing, all-composite shark fins and a new generation of engines, is expected to be delivered to the customer TAP Portugal in the next few weeks. The A350-1000 uses the latest in aerodynamic design and advanced technology to deliver unparalleled efficiency and comfort on long-haul routes.

The Airbus Services section at the Airbus booth will showcase the company's evolving service business, including information on its latest digital platform, Skywise, and a new upgrade to cabin software.

A series of Airbus helicopter models will be on display at the Airbus booth, including the H130, a versatile light single-engine helicopter in the squirrel family, the H116, the latest generation of Airbus helicopters, and the new generation of super-medium helicopter H175, developed and manufactured by 50:50.

Airbus Defence and Space will showcase the PléiadesNeo satellite model. The satellite is an ultra-high-resolution Earth observation satellite constellation designed by Airbus and consisting of four satellites. It is ideal for accurate mapping and in-depth analysis, and is also particularly suitable for emergency response and daily change monitoring. With industry-leading image acquisition success rates, Pléiades is the perfect choice for custom acquisitions and timely decision making, enabling observation tasks even in places where manpower is difficult to reach.

The booth will also feature “Innovative Journey to Airbus”, which includes some of the most innovative projects the company is undertaking, which will ultimately change the way people travel, connect and interact.

From November 6th to 8th, the latest member of the Airbus single-aisle aircraft series, an A220-300 aircraft (operated by Baltic Airlines) will be statically displayed at the air show. Later, as a stop on its global tour, the A220-300 will fly to Chengdu for display.

A public service-equipped H145 helicopter operated by the Guangzhou Municipal Public Security Bureau, the first H145 helicopter in mainland China, will also be on display in the static display area. The H145 is the newest member of the Airbus Helicopter 4 ton dual-engine helicopter product line with exceptionally designed mission capabilities and flexibility. The H145 helicopter can be equipped with a modern mission management system to meet a variety of mission needs, particularly police, emergency medical services (EMS) and search and rescue (SAR).

In addition, a H135 helicopter will be on display at the Airbus Helicopter China distributor, Qingdao United General Aviation Industry Development Co., Ltd. (UGA) booth. The helicopter is equipped with the latest medical equipment and the latest generation of Airbus's Helionix avionics system (also used in H145, H160 and H175 helicopters) to increase safety and reduce pilot workload. According to the framework agreement signed in June 2016, this is the first of the 100 H135 helicopters delivered to China.

Airbus will hold a press conference on Tuesday, November 6 at 12:40 pm on the second floor of Room 220.The executives of Airbus China will introduce Airbus' latest business in China and provide the latest information on products and markets.

During the air show, Airbus will also organize a variety of R&D and innovation seminars, as well as human resources activities, including the Airbus Global University Partnership (AGUPP). The program aims to strengthen ties with university professors and ambassadors around the world to better develop future talent and promote career development for young professionals in the industry.

Heading: Review of the Crash: Blue Fox Is Still Analyzing the Black Box at the Home Side Crash
Article.Description: Vicky WAS Riding The Agusta-Westland AW169 Twin-Engine 10-SEAT Helicopter. Of The Helicopter WAS Very Smooth When IT WAS Launched, But When The Helicopter WAS READY to Turn, The the Fuselage Began to Spin and Eventually Lost Control and Eventually Fell ON The Pitch . Parking nearby.
Full_Article:
In the 10th round of the Premier League, Leicester City's home game against West Ham, Leicester City boss Wei guess also appeared in the game, and after the game, Wei guessed by convention to take the helicopter to leave the Wang Quan Stadium.

But surprisingly, this turned out to be the end of the life of Vicky.


Vicky WAS Riding The Agusta-Westland AW169 Twin-Engine 10-SEAT Helicopter. Of The Helicopter WAS Very Smooth When IT WAS Launched, But When The Helicopter WAS READY to Turn, The the Fuselage Began to Spin and Eventually Lost Control and Eventually Fell ON The Pitch . Parking nearby.


A party named Sanne happened to be near the inciden t. He also saw the whole process of the plane falling: "I heard the sound of the helicopter, saw it directly above the stadium, and then made an unusual sound. Then it tilted and The propeller stopped spinning. The pilot tried to stay away from the stadium because there were still many people in the stadiu m. Then it fell near the parking lot, and then exploded, then it caught fire. It is."


The plane crashed and caused a fire, and the local police officers quickly came to the plane of the crash, hoping to rescue the wounded, but the fire was too big to be rescued.

The local police also quickly dispatched a capable police force to fight the fire, and the emergency committee also came to the scene to save people.

But in the end, five people, including Vicki, died in the accident.


After the incident, there were many reasons for the plane's fall.

Some people have suspected that the accident was caused by a collision between a helicopter and a police drone on the court.

But then the Leicester police rumored: "For security reasons, we did deploy drones, but when the helicopter took off on Saturday, there was no drone over the course."


In recent days, the video of the plane crash was exposed. After watching the video, aviation expert David Lilmont talked about his views on the air crash. He believed that the lateral rotor of the helicopter tail was likely to be faulty at the time, Causing air crash.

But this is only his family's words.


The black box of the current crashed aircraft has been found, and the British Air Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) will restore and restore the data as soon as possible in order to investigate the truth of the accident.

Heading: Aviation Experts Analyze the Cause of the Crash of the Plane Guessing: Lateral Rotor Failure
Article.Description: Vicky was riding the Agusta-Westland AW169 twin-engine 10-seat helicopter. From the published video, there was no problem with the helicopter hovering, but after rising to a certain height, the fuselage Suddenly began to spin, eventually losing control and falling rapidly. (Machine Translated from Chinese)
Full_Article:
Recently, the video of the private helicopter crash of the Leicester City boss Wichi guessed, and aviation experts guessed the cause of the crash.

Vicky was riding the Agusta-Westland AW169 twin-engine 10-seat helicopter. From the published video, there was no problem with the helicopter hovering, but after rising to a certain height, the fuselage Suddenly began to spin, eventually losing control and falling rapidly.

After watching the video of the crash, aviation expert David Lilmont talked about his view of the crash. "The helicopter does not see any abnormality during the launch, but flying off the court is a troublesome operation because In general, you need some speed of advancement and continue to climb, but after the pilots climbed vertically above the height of the stadium, they made a move to prepare for the turn and then lost control of the aircraft."

David Lilmont thought that the helicopter's lateral rotor was likely to have encountered a fault, which was the main cause of the air crash. "The lateral rotor failure will cause the aircraft to lose thrust and then fall quickly. In this case, The pilot should return the side rotor to the neutral state as quickly as possible, and then turn off the power as soon as possible to ensure that the rotor rotates and the helicopter enters the taxiing state."

To make such an emergency operation, the premise is that the flight altitude is high enough, but the height of the helicopter may not be enough, causing the pilot to fail to make emergency operations in time, David Lilmont said, “Once the fuselage begins. It’s almost impossible to rotate and try to do all the work."

Heading: US S-76B Changed Helicopter Cockpit Crew Automation System Successfully Demonstrated Autonomous Flight Capability
Article.Description: US Army pilots supervised their autonomy through a series of missions, commanding drone support helicopters to showcase technology developed by Sikorsky, Lockheed Martin and the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency. This series of flights marks the first time Sikorsky pilots have operated the modified S-76B commercial helicopter Sikorsky Automated Research Aircraft as a drone-supported helicopter aircraft. (Machine Translated from Chinese)
Full_Article:
In mid-October, US Army pilots supervised their autonomy through a series of missions, commanding drone support helicopters to showcase technology developed by Sikorsky, Lockheed Martin and the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency. This series of flights marks the first time Sikorsky pilots have operated the modified S-76B commercial helicopter Sikorsky Automated Research Aircraft (SARA) as a drone-supported helicopter aircraft.

“Future vertical lift aircraft will require strong autonomous and optimal driving systems to accomplish missions and improve safety,” said Chris Van Buiten, vice president of innovation at Sikorsky. “We are more excited to welcome Army pilots to the cockpit and experience the reliability of the best driving techniques developed by Sikorsky and the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency. These pilots have experienced our installation and testing on the Black Hawk. The same technology, this will be the first flight in the coming months."

With more than 30 hours of autonomous flight, Sikorsky Automated Research Aircraft successfully demonstrated the advanced capabilities developed as part of the third phase of the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency's Cockpit Crew Automation System (ALIAS) program. The pilot on board the ship and the pilot on the ground operate at different times. Sikorsky's MATRIXTM technology autonomous software and hardware is installed on the SikorskyAutomation Research Aircraft to perform a variety of programs, including:

Automatic take-off and landing: the helicopter automatically takes off, goes to the destination, and automatically landed

Obstacle avoidance: Helicopter's onboard lidar measurement technology andcamera enable it to detect and avoid unknown objects such as wires, towers andmoving vehicles

Automatic landing zone selection: Helicopter's airborne lidar measurement technology sensor identifies a safe landing zone

Contour flight: helicopter flies to the ground and behind the tree

The most recent mission software flight show was in collaboration with the US Army Aviation Development Council, Sikorsky and the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency. The Army and Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency is working with Sikorsky to improve and expand the cockpit crew automation system capabilities as a customizable autonomous device that can be installed on fixed-wing aircraft and helicopters.

In the next few months, Sikorsky will be driving the Black Hawk with the cockpit crew automation system for the first time. The company is working closely with the US Federal Aviation Administration to certify the cockpit crew automation system / MATRIX technology for use on existing and future commercial andmilitary aircraft.

“We are demonstrating a provable autonomous solution that will revolutionize the way pilots fly,” said Mark Ward, chief pilot of Sikorsky Flight Test Center in Stratford, Connecticut. “We believe that MATRIX technology will allow pilots to focus on their mission. This technology will ultimately reduce the primary cause of helicopter crashes: Controlled Flight Impact (CFIT).”

Through the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency's cockpit crew automation system program, Sikorsky is developing a drone-assisted helicopterapproach that describes it as pilot-oriented autonomy, which will give operators confidence to be safe in the best driving mode. The aircraft is driven reliably andeconomically to achieve the flight of two, one or zero crew members. The program will improve operators' decision-making on man-made operations while also enabling unmanned driving and reduced crew operations.

Heading: Jiangxi Changhe Agusta Helicopter Awarded the Latest 145 Repair License
Article.Description: The approved maintenance capability of the AW119 helicopter is 3,200 hours of inspection capability. This level of maintenance capability is also the highest level of maintenance capability of the AW119 helicopter. At this point, CAH has become the most complete and capable helicopter of the existing Leonardo helicopters in China. CCAR-145 maintenance unit, maintenance capacity includes: AW109 series helicopter 3200 hours inspection and maintenance capability. (Machine Translated from Chinese)
Full_Article:
On October 18, 2018, Jiangxi Changhe Agusta Helicopter Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as CAH) successfully passed the application for the maintenance capability upgrade of the Civil Aviation East China Regional Administration and authorized CAH's new maintenance capability qualification.

The approved maintenance capability of the AW119 helicopter is 3,200 hours of inspection capability. This level of maintenance capability is also the highest level of maintenance capability of the AW119 helicopter.

At this point, CAH has become the most complete and capable helicopter of the existing Leonardo helicopters in China. CCAR-145 maintenance unit, maintenance capabilities include: AW109 series helicopter 3200 hours inspection and maintenance capabilities; AW119 series helicopter 3200 hours inspection and maintenance capabilities; AW139 helicopter 1200 hours / four years inspection and maintenance capabilities.

Heading: H145 Helicopter Further Enhances Competitiveness and Operational Capability
Article.Description: The warranty period for the Airbus H145 helicopter Arriel 2E engine is extended from two years/1000 hours to three years/2000 hours, and customers will benefit from this. This extension applies to H145 helicopters delivered after January 2018. (Machine Translated from Chinese)
Full_Article:
The warranty period for the Airbus H145 helicopter Arriel 2E engine is extended from two years/1000 hours to three years/2000 hours, and customers will benefit from this. This extension applies to H145 helicopters delivered after January 2018.

In addition, Airbus has deployed the Helionix Step3 on the H145, an enhanced version of the Airbus Helionix digital avionics system that enhances situational awareness, increases availability, accelerates helicopter connectivity, and reduces maintenance costs.

Thanks to the new Synthetic Vision System, which recognizes obstacles, the Helionix Step 3 enhances the situational awareness of pilots and crews compared to the Helionix Step 2. In addition, aviation facilities such as runways and helipads, as well as ground objects such as urban areas, roads and railways, are now more easily discovered by crew members, thus ensuring safer operations.

Helionix also tracks flight times and measures the exact flight time between takeoff and landing. Due to the precise tracking of flight times, the flight duration can be extended by 20% over the same maintenance interval compared to conventional flight tracking using pilot logs, thereby saving direct maintenance costs by up to 6%.

The upgrade will also facilitate helicopter connectivity, allowing operators to transmit their usage data through an optional communications server during helicopter flight.

"Engine Extended Warranty and Helionix upgrades will provide customers with greater value and provide safer operations, enabling operators to take advantage of the large amount of data generated by each voyage," said Airbus H145 project lead Axel Humpert.

The Helionix Step 3 is also used in the H175 and will soon be deployed on the H135 helicopter. The H145 helicopter is the market leader in police and rescue missions, with more than 200 global fleets and a total of more than 100,000 flight hours.

Heading: Airbus CEO Succession Finalized: Current Airbus Civil Aircraft President Faury Will Take Over Next Year
Article.Description: With strong values ??and international ideas, Faury will be the representative of a new generation of leaders needed for Airbus in the next decade. (Machine Translated from Chinese)
Full_Article:
On October 9th, News reporter learned from Airbus that its board of directors chose Guillaume Faury? as the CEO of the company in the future.
Guillaume Faury is 50 years old and is currently the president of Airbus Civil Aircraft. He held various senior management positions at Eurocopter from 1998 to 2008, including related positions in engineering and flight testing, and subsequently became executive vice president of commercial projects and executive vice president of research and development.

In 2009, Guillaume Faury joined Peugeot as a Vice President of Research and Development and a member of the Management Committee. In May 2013, he returned to Airbus as CEO of Airbus Helicopter and served as the helm of Airbus civilian aircraft in early 2018.

Thomas Enders, currently CEO of Airbus, is 59 years old and will continue to serve until the company's annual general meeting on April 10, 2019. By then, Thomas Enders will serve Airbus for 14 years. Its future position change decision is made by its initiative to the board of directors.

At the 2019 general meeting of shareholders, the appointment of Guillaume Faury? as an executive member of the board of directors will also be submitted to shareholders for consideration.

Thomas Enders said, “Faury? is an excellent choice. Over the years, he has held various positions within and outside Airbus and gained extensive experience in the industrial and aviation industry. With strong values ??and international ideas, Fu It will be the representative of a new generation of leaders needed for Airbus in the next decade. I will also do my best to support him and ensure a smooth and smooth transition."
Guillaume Faury? said that he was honored to be selected by the board of directors and looked forward to meeting this new challenge in a passionate and enthusiastic way. In the next few months, he will continue to lead the civil aircraft business and complete the smooth handover of the company's management.

Dennis Rank, the current chairman of the Airbus Board of Directors, explained the process of selecting a successor. “We are fully prepared for this succession and reached a consensus conclusion after a thorough review of all internal and external candidates.”

In Dennis Rank, Guillaume's global vision, rich operational experience, strong personal values ??and straightforward leadership style make it a united Airbus team that creates value for customers, partners and shareholders. The ideal candidate.

In addition, Dennis Ranke said that the board is very grateful to Thomas Enders. "In the past two decades, he has been serving Airbus with full enthusiasm and has achieved great success. The company is under the leadership of Enders. Strategic, structural and management transformations enable Airbus to better follow its performance trajectory and continue to fulfill its commitment to shareholders and the broader financial community in the future."

According to Airbus, Dennis Ranke will continue to serve as Chairman of the Board until the end of the April 2020 term, in line with expectations for the succession of the Board of Directors proposed at the 2016 Annual General Meeting. The Board of Directors will begin to select the new chairman in due course in accordance with the principle of “maintaining the importance of internationalization and diversification of the board of directors and management” mentioned in the internal regulations.

Heading: Joining Chinese Partners to Embrace Open Opportunities - Overseas Exhibitors "Like" China Expo
Article.Description: Xu Gang, CEO of Airbus China, said that Airbus is optimistic about China's civilian helicopter market in the next few years, especially in the public service mission area. (Machine Translated from Chinese)
Full_Article:
The first China International Import Expo will be held in Shanghai from November 5th to 10th. More than 2,800 companies from more than 130 countries and regions have confirmed their participation. Overseas companies seized the opportunity and actively participated in the exhibition, becoming the best commentary for foreign investors to be optimistic about China's economic development and to see more Chinese markets.

Expanding opening up and promoting global trade

Overseas exhibitors highly value this year's Expo, and believe that the exhibition is a concrete measure for China to implement a new round of high-level opening up, and is also a practical contribution of China to help the world economy develop.

As one of the earliest American companies to participate in the Expo, Meng Pu, chairman of Qualcomm China, believes that the Expo is a major “creative” for China to expand its opening up and will be a sign of China's new round of opening up. "The holding of the Expo is at the 40th anniversary of China's reform and opening up, and it is also a crucial period for China's economic transformation and upgrading. The importance is self-evident."

In the eyes of the head of Hyundai Motor Co., Korea, the Expo shows the confidence and vision of China as an open country. Li Hezhen, executive deputy general manager of Hyundai Motor (China) Investment Co., Ltd., believes that the China Expo is a major decision made by China to focus on a new round of high-level opening up. He told reporters that in the context of trade protectionism threatening the development of the world economy, the Expo will be unique in promoting trade globalization, which will help China to improve its openness and build a platform for mutual benefit and win-win results.

Seize the rare opportunity to deepen the Chinese market

The Expo is a good opportunity for companies to expand their market share in China and is the best platform for companies to explore the Chinese market.

“I am very pleased to see such a large-scale German company applying for participation.” Thomas Koenig, Director of the East Asian Division of the German Chamber of Commerce and Industry, said excitedly about the registration of 170 German companies.

It is understood that the number of exhibiting companies in Germany is among the best in the participating countries, and well-known companies such as BMW, Siemens, Metro and Bayer are fully registered. “The Expo is a good opportunity for German companies operating in China for a long time to fully display their products and services. It is also a rare opportunity for German companies that have not yet explored the Chinese market. During the show, they will have more Contact the Chinese market," König said.

Many countries and regions or industry associations have also organized enterprises to participate in the Expo, in the hope of opening up the Chinese market or expanding their business in China. The Greater Houston Cooperation Council organized 12 Houston companies to participate in the Expo, covering high-tech, manufacturing, energy, logistics and agriculture. Oracio Liken, vice president of the Greater Houston Cooperation Committee, said that the participating Houston companies will personally experience the Chinese business environment, listen to China's future economic development plan, and learn how to share China's development dividend through first-hand information.

Cooperate with consumption upgrade, focus on innovation cooperation

With the transition of China's economy to a high-quality development stage, effectively connecting China's demand with the world's high-quality supply has become an important way for China-foreign international cooperation to achieve mutual benefit and win-win results. Overseas exhibitors have seen participating in the Expo as a platform to expand China's consumption upgrade market and showcase technological and service innovations in various countries.

David Roth, WPP executive of the world-renowned communication service group, said that with the economic transformation of China, science and technology enterprises have become the engine of Chinese brand development, and China's position in the global value chain is improving.

In the eyes of the Turkish home appliance company Becker, the Expo is a showcase for the company's innovation and new technology applications. Hakan Burgullu, CEO of Alcolix, the parent company of Beko, said that about 25% of the household appliances sold in China are connected, compared with only 3% to 4% in other parts of the world, indicating Chinese consumption. Those who are willing to try new technologies need high-end products, designs and technologies.

Hyundai Motor Co., Ltd. also plans to showcase NEXO, a new generation of hydrogen fuel cell vehicle, at the Expo to show Chinese consumers the cutting-edge R&D of modern energy technology for hydrogen. Hyundai Motor said that it will promote the flow of production factors and optimize resource allocation between the two countries, and will also help promote the innovation and transformation and upgrading of the automobile industry in the two countries.

Airbus will participate in the Expo in the form of a French booth, focusing on products such as OneWeb and Aeolus satellite models. Xu Gang, CEO of Airbus China, said that Airbus is optimistic about China's civilian helicopter market in the next few years, especially in the public service mission area.

Qualcomm, which has been deeply involved in the Chinese market for 20 years, also hopes to “further” in the Chinese market. Meng Pu said that the cooperation between Qualcomm and Chinese partners in the past mainly focused on the mobile phone field. With the technology derivative, cooperation will gradually expand into emerging fields such as driverless, IoT applications and integrated circuit manufacturing. "I hope to use the exchange platform built by the Expo to showcase innovative technologies and products and services, and join hands with Chinese partners to showcase the vision and value of the Smart Internet era to the world."

Heading: The AW189 Helicopter Is Here! Another Star Exhibit of the Import Expo Arrived in Shanghai
Article.Description: The AW189 helicopter has the industry's leading integrated avionics system and drive train and final drive with 50 minutes of dry running capability. It is equipped with two GE high-power turbine engines with a maximum cruising speed of 287 km/h and can carry two tons of fuel with a maximum range of 1,11 km. (Machine Translated from Chinese)
Full_Article:
At about 4:30 pm on October 20, at the apron of Shanghai Gaodong Heliport, the AW189 helicopter landed slowly in a huge roar.

This is the latest high-performance 8.6-ton super medium-sized twin-engine helicopter with a total value of nearly 200 million yuan, or will be the highest-priced aviation exhibit at the first China International Import Expo . The AW189 helicopter has the industry's leading integrated avionics system and drive train and final drive with 50 minutes of dry running capability. It is equipped with two GE high-power turbine engines with a maximum cruising speed of 287 km/h and can carry two tons of fuel with a maximum range of 1,11 km. At the same time, it can carry up to 19 passengers and can be flexibly used in various complex environments such as sea commuting, search and rescue, law enforcement, etc., to meet the most stringent standards of the offshore oil transportation industry.

The AW189 helicopter that came to Shanghai this time was transferred from Malaysia to the Americas. The spacious cabin and large sliding doors make for a comfortable ride, easy access and cargo loading. The seat is installed in a position where the wide push-pull window is aligned, ensuring that the fastest time can be reached at the exit during an emergency landing or a water landing. The structural anti-collision system has been preferentially injected into the design of the fuselage, fuel system and seat. The reinforced windshield greatly relieves the impact of the bird's impact. The cockpit design incorporates the most advanced "environmental recognition technology" available today, greatly reducing the pilot's work intensity.

The AW189 helicopter completed its first flight in December 2011. It has sold more than 150 aircraft worldwide and nearly 60 of them are in active service. It is the most successful super medium-sized commercial helicopter in the world. Due to its outstanding performance and strong loading capacity, it has become the preferred model in the fields of maritime search and rescue, fire fighting and offshore oil operations. On July 3, 2018, the model successfully obtained the China Civil Aviation Authority Model Approval Certificate (VTC).

It is reported that this AW189 helicopter will fly to another aviation ground service point in the morning, after being demolished and modified, and then transported to the Expo Exhibition Area. At that time, it will be stationed in Hall 4, the smart and high-end equipment exhibition area, along with two other star models.

Exhibitors said that they hope to expand the docking channel of the Chinese helicopter market with the help of the Expo platform, and promote the establishment of the Leonardo helicopter in China localization training center and production completion center; layout production completion center, market sales, training center, after-sales The helicopter industry chain, which is an integrated material, contributes to the innovation and development of the Chinese helicopter industry.

Heading: Bell APT UAV System Selected by NASA as Next Generation ATC System Demonstration Model
Article.Description: The company of the Textron Group has announced that it has signed a cooperation agreement with NASA, and Bell will use the new APT 70 UAV system. Implementation of the NAS  Demonstration Project, which will be implemented in 2020, is dedicated to advancing the integration of commercial UAV systems into a new generation of airspace management systems. (Machine Translated from Chinese)
Full_Article:
The company of the Textron Group has announced that it has signed a cooperation agreement with NASA (National Space Agency), and Bell will use the new APT 70 UAV system. Implementation of the NAS (National Air Traffic Control System) Demonstration Project, which will be implemented in 2020, is dedicated to advancing the integration of commercial UAV systems into a new generation of airspace management systems.

Bell will work with Textron Systems, Xwing and the University of Massachusetts Amherst Atmospheric Cooperative Adaptive Sensing Center (CASA) to develop a Bell APT 70 ( Autonomous Pod Transport 70) UAV system for demonstration projects. The man-machine system is equipped with the Command and Control (C2) system provided by Textron Systems and the Detection and Avoidance (DAA) system provided by Xwing. In addition, CASA will also provide a weather avoidance system for the drone system. Bell will be responsible for leading the development, design, production and system integration of the APT UAV system.

At that time, the APT 70 UAV system will conduct a peer-to-peer mission demonstration to verify the feasibility of the drone in medical, public law enforcement andoffshore missions. "We are confident in the APT project and believe that with the joint efforts of the team, we can address the key challenges of the commercial operation of drones," said Scott Drennan, vice president of innovation at Bell.

The APT 70 is part of Bell's family of electric vertical takeoff and landing drones (eVTOL), thanks to Bell's proven tilting rotorcraft technology, and the Bell APT 70 in a Tail-sitting layout can be in the air. The rotor attitude and fixed-wing attitude are switched to maximize flight performance with a maximum flight speed of 161 km/h and a basic load of 31.75 kg.

Heading: Bell and Yamato Holding Group Sign Framework Cooperation Agreement to Deploy on-Demand Logistics Transportation Services
Article.Description: Bell and Yamato Holding Group will jointly develop innovative automated drone systems and parcel handling systems to provide customers with an unparalleled on-demand logistics service customer experience. The prototype product of the project is expected to be operational in mid-2020. (Machine Translated from Chinese)
Full_Article:
The company of the Textron Group has announced that it has signed a framework cooperation agreement with Japan's Yamato Holding Group (TYO:9064) to jointly deploy the future civil air logistics transportation business. To become the world's leading eVTOL (electric vertical takeoff and landing) logistics service provider. Bell and Yamato Holding Group will jointly develop innovative automated drone systems and parcel handling systems to provide customers with an unparalleled on-demand logistics service customer experience. The prototype product of the project is expected to be operational in mid-2020.

“In the past few years, Bell's team has continued to develop innovative and innovative solutions to better serve Bell customers around the world. We are very excited to define the civil logistics industry again based on our own professional advantages. Business form," said Scott Drennan , vice president of Bell Innovations . “We hope that through this cooperation, we will set a precedent for on-demand logistics and future large-scale logistics services.”

In the initial demonstration phase, Bell will lead the design, development and production of the APT automatic transport cabin; at the same time, the Yamato Holding Group will be responsible for the development of customized component pods that will meet the ground requirements for future logistics missions. Sorting ability. The goal of Bell and Yamato Holding Group is to integrate three-dimensional drone logistics transportation services into the existing ground logistics network to provide customers with new and innovative services.

“We have been operating logistics services for nearly a century. Today, we are very excited to work with Bell to invest in the future and create a new generation of logistics technology solutions to provide our customers with a higher level of service.” Yamato Shinji Makiura, Managing Group's Innovation and Business Strategy MEO (Management Executive).

The Bell APT eVTOL drone system features a tail-tailed layout with a maximum flight speed of 100 mph. The APT's modular design allows for loads ranging from 15 pounds up to 1000 pounds in different configurations. Thanks to this, APT will create a higher level of dispatch and operational efficiency.

Heading: 1 Hour! Shanghai Direct Flights to Hengdian, Open to Traffic!

An hour ago, we were still watching the traffic in the city in Shanghai. After an hour, we had already played in the scenic spot of Hengdian. Listening like the Arabian Nights, an hour, more than 260 kilometers, how is it possible? This seemingly impossible thing was achieved by a helicopter on the morning of October 21.

On the morning of the same day, the reporter took the helicopter of Shanghai Xinkong Helicopter Co., Ltd., shortening the original four or five hours to one hour, and flew to Hengdian Airport from the Tomson Golf Course in Pudong, Shanghai, and experienced the first flight of the helicopter charter.

At 9 o'clock in the morning, at the Pudong Tomson Golf Course in Shanghai, the New Bell Helicopter Co., Ltd.'s American Bell 429 helicopter is preparing for the pre- launch . Cao Xintian, chairman of Xinkong Helicopter Co., Ltd., served as the captain of the flight. He said that the distance from Shanghai to Hengdian is about 260 kilometers, passing through Shanghai Huangpu River, Hangzhou Bay, Ningbo Andong, Zhangzhou and other places. It is understood that the US Bell 429 helicopter is the main operating model of New Air Helicopter Co., Ltd., the maximum cruising speed can reach 263 km / h (average speed of 240 km / h). This model is a comfortable business configuration, and the various facilities in the cabin are luxurious and safe.

Before taking off, the reporter entered the cabin for an experience. The entire cabin is spacious and comfortable, and the interior is luxurious. It is equipped with club-style seats. It can accommodate 5 people. There are reading lights and call buttons on the top of each seat. Each seat is also equipped with a BOSE noise-reducing earphone. At 10 o'clock in the morning, the helicopter took off smoothly and flew over Shanghai, 200 meters from the ground. In the cabin, the reporter can clearly see the ground conditions and look at the beauty of Shanghai from another perspective. After a period of flight, the helicopter entered Zhejiang, and the flight altitude also rose to about 1,700 meters.

This is the first time a reporter has taken a helicopter. In advance, he is worried that there may be bumps, airsickness, and other discomfort during the flight. There may be fear in the sky. From the moment the plane took off, all the concerns were dispelled. During the flight, the reporter's biggest feeling is that the mood is relaxed, the ride experience is comfortable and stable, and the cabin can be easily talked through the noise-reduction headphones, can make calls, and enjoy the beautiful scenery with a pleasant mood.

At 11:05, after about an hour, the helicopter arrived safely at Hengdian Airport, which means that the helicopter charter service from Shanghai to Hengdian successfully achieved its first flight. The person in charge of Zhejiang Hengdian Aviation Industry Co., Ltd. introduced that the official navigation of the route has greatly shortened the time and space distance between Hengdian and Shanghai, shortening the original four or five hours to one hour, making the journey less boaty and more aerial overlooking. The beauty of the package will be the norm in the future.

It is understood that Xinkong Helicopter Co., Ltd. is the helicopter operating unit of the CCAR-135 operation certificate, and is the only 135 operating unit of the helicopter that is mainly engaged in VIP charter service in East China. Shanghai passengers can choose to board a flight at a total of 7 landing points in the six districts of the city. Hengdian passengers can also choose to board 7 attractions and hotels (one of them).

At a time when the city is getting more and more congested, many people dream of flying. Nowadays, it is no longer a dream to fly. After the official flight to Shanghai Hengdian helicopter charter, it can greatly shorten the travel time for business people, and also provide a beautiful journey for the tourists to see the scenery in the air.

Heading: Four Navigation Companies in Southwest China Receive Disaster Relief Missions to Build Air Passages
Article.Description: Chongqing Airlines dispatched a Bell 412EP helicopter (Machine No. B-70JT) flew to the disaster area via Xinjin, Luding, Daofu and other places. Hump navigation prepared two Bell 407GXP helicopters (numbers B-70XX, B-711A) to be on standby. (Machine Translated from Chinese)
Full_Article:
At 7:10 on October 11, a landslide occurred at the junction of Jiangda County, Changdu City, Tibet, and Baiyu County, Ganzi Prefecture, Sichuan Province, causing the Jinsha River to stop and form a dammed lake. The emergency management department and other departments established an emergency linkage disposal mechanism. , fully assist in guiding local rescue and rescue.

Xilin Fengteng Navigation, Chongqing Navigation, Harmony Navigation and Hump Navigation in the southwestern region are actively preparing for disaster relief as required. Xilin Fengteng and Harmony Navigation respectively transported one helicopter (Airbus H125, aircraft B-70NG, Airbus AS350B3 , machine number 70MF) to the disaster area through ground transportation facilities and equipment. Chongqing Airlines dispatched a Bell 412EP helicopter ( Machine No. B-70JT) flew to the disaster area via Xinjin, Luding, Daofu and other places. Hump navigation prepared two Bell 407GXP helicopters (numbers B-70XX, B-711A) to be on standby.

The Southwest Bureau attaches great importance to this disaster relief task. It regularly reports the disaster relief flight information to the Civil Aviation Administration on a daily basis, actively coordinates the relevant units to cooperate with the navigation enterprise to perform the tasks, and requires all navigation companies to put flight safety in the first place, carefully deploying, carefully prepared, and strict standards. Ensure that tasks are completed safely and effectively, without adding to the disaster relief work.

As of 20:00 on the 14th, Xilin Fengteng Navigation Helicopter arrived at Baiyu at 10:35 on the same day, then immediately assembled the test flight to perform the mission, took off at 16:25 for the first mission, and observed the route weather and the aircraft drop point, 17:10 The second sorting mission was carried out, and three fire-fighting experts and media personnel were transported, and the Baiyu landing point was safely returned at 17:39. The Harmony Navigation Helicopter will arrive in Jiangda County on the night of the 14th. The Chongqing navigation helicopter failed to complete the transition due to weather conditions. The two helicopters on which the hump is navigating are still on standby.

Heading: Airbus Racer High Speed ??Presenter Passes Preliminary Design Review
Article.Description: Airbus Helicopter continues to advance the development of the Racer (fast and cost-effective helicopter) technology demonstrator project. The project was funded by the European Union's H2020 framework through the Clean Sky 2 program to provide the best balance between speed, cost effectiveness, sustainability and mission performance. (Machine Translated from Chinese)
Full_Article:
Airbus Helicopter continues to advance the development of the Racer (fast and cost-effective helicopter) technology demonstrator project. The project was funded by the European Union's H2020 framework through the Clean Sky 2 program to provide the best balance between speed, cost effectiveness, sustainability and mission performance.

Following the validation of the aerodynamic configuration of the demonstrator last year, key subsystems have now successfully passed the preliminary design review (PDR), paving the way for the first component manufacturing. The final assembly work of the prototype is scheduled to begin in the fourth quarter of 2019.

“I want to thank all European partners for their excellent work performance and their commitment to this outstanding project,” said Tomasz Krysinski, Airbus Helicopter Research and Innovation Director. “Preliminary Design Review (PDR) marks one of the Racer plans. Major achievements."

The first component that was put into production was the long-term component. The Airbus Helicopter team has begun producing lateral driveshafts, one of Racer's most innovative components. Among the key subsystems, GE Air Italy's Avio Aero is sourcing and manufacturing the aircraft's transverse gearbox housing. GE Aviation Integrated Systems, based in Hamp, UK, is in charge of the wing's titanium bracket components. Manufacturing. Romania's INCAS/Romaero has begun production of Racer's composite side panels, and Spain's Aernnova has begun the production of the main structural parts of the tail.

Together with its partners, Airbus Helicopter is currently refining the content of the future Racer II demonstration in the Clean Sky Phase II program, which will begin in 2020, including approximately 200 flight hours. The first part will focus on gradually opening the flight envelope to assess key performance indicators as well as speed, handling, stability and aerodynamic performance. The second phase will aim to demonstrate whether aircraft are capable of performing potential tasks, with significant added value at higher speeds and efficiencies, such as emergency medical services (EMS), search and rescue (SAR), and private transportation. The second phase of the flight test will also complement the low noise flight procedure, which is unique to the Racer demonstrator solution.

Heading: After the Downturn, It Will Rise Again! The Road to Rebirth of "Super Puma
Article.Description: According to the US "Robo Report" reported on October 3, Airbus Helicopter Company tried to persuade all regulators to introduce "Super Puma" and promised them that the safety performance of the aircraft has been perfected and can be completely continued. (Machine Translated from Chinese)
Full_Article:
According to the US "Robo Report" reported on October 3, Airbus Helicopter Company tried to persuade all regulators to introduce "Super Puma" and promised them that the safety performance of the aircraft has been perfected and can be completely continued. work. But the company's major customers, such as most oil and gas producers, say they have no intention of introducing the "super jaguar" in the future , and not even one H225 to resume operations in the fringe of the northeastern Atlantic.

The reason for these attitudes is probably because of the accident:

On April 29, 2016, an H225 Airbus helicopter (LN-OJF) crashed in an accident in Norway. The transmission failed during the flight, causing the main rotor blade of the Super Puma to be completely separated from the main body of the aircraft. All 13 people on board were killed.

After the price of crude oil plummeted

A brutal oil and gas crisis has taken place. About 71% of the civilian H225 fleet (122 aircraft) are engaged in offshore oil and gas operations, most of which are in the marginal waters of the northeastern Atlantic. At the time, the H225 accounted for 40% of the modern heavy-duty helicopter offshore market. After the flight, its main competitor Sikorsky S-92, as well as some smaller new generation helicopters (mainly H175 and Leonardo) The AW189 helicopter) began to replace it.

Given the slow recovery of the oil and gas industry, even without H225, the market is still trapped in overcapacity , and this dilemma is expected to continue for some time.

Excessive inventory

In fact, helicopter operators have realized that these redundant H225 aircraft are no longer needed in the oil and gas business. This can be seen from the slow recovery of service, as by July 2017, when the aircraft was finally cleared on the Norwegian and British lists, 85% of the fleet was still being stored. Since CHC filed a bankruptcy protection application under Chapter 11 of the Bankruptcy Law and received a lease return, 42% of the fleet is in the hands of the bank or the leasing company.

This problem has existed in the past, and it is still grim now. The focus of the issue is mainly on the customer, and especially the passengers' perception of safety, but Norwegian investigators have been unable to determine exactly what caused the main gearbox to crack .

Future market forecast

The latest peak in 2014 shows that the global maritime support fleet now has a total of 1980 rotorcraft, which has increased to 356 since 2008, as new and more efficient aircraft enter the market, coincident with oil production and exploration activities. Increasing.

But the plunge in oil prices has caused oil companies to cut costs, and the helicopter fleet has suffered huge losses; since reaching its peak in 2014, the number of active helicopters has fallen by 14% (or 280 helicopters) and, in terms of current sales prospects Its usage rate has dropped significantly .

Ascend predicts that a total of 8,350 civilian turbo helicopters will be delivered over the next 10 years, for a total value of $46 billion. At present, there are 26,000 turbo helicopters in the world that are about to retire, and will purchase more than half of the helicopters. Ascend's data shows that 70% of aircraft have been in service for 30 years, " so there is now a large fleet that can be replaced. "

From a regional perspective, Asia Pacific's delivery in the next 10 years should account for 33%, more than 26% in North America. Europe will account for 23% and Latin America for 10%. However, North America will retain the largest fleet, accounting for 34% of the total 2027 fleet. Ascend expects Airbus to lead the market with 37% delivery and 44% value.

H225's experience shows how quickly it can adapt to a downturn in the market, whether it has a keen insight . Although the H225's redundant, surplus fleet may take some time to be digested by the market, in the past few months, we have seen them gradually recover from the depressed market.

Heading: Royal Dutch Travel Club and Airbus Signed Six H135 Famework Agreements
Article.Description: Royal Dutch Travel Club and Airbus signed a six H135 helicopter framework agreement with the Helionix avionics system. The first three helicopters will be delivered between 2019 and 2020. (Machine Translated from Chinese)
Full_Article:
Airbus Helicopter and Air Rescue Operator The Royal Dutch Travel Club ANWB signed a six H135 helicopter framework agreement with the Helionix avionics system. The first three helicopters will be delivered between 2019 and 2020.

“The Dutch people rely on the Helicopter Emergency Medical Service (HEMS) we offer in partnership with four university hospitals, and we believe the H135 helicopter is the best choice for this task,” said Petra van Saaze, Director of Medical Air Assistance at ANWB. Helionix will help us strengthen our 24/7 operational capabilities.

“We are grateful to ANWB for its trust in Airbus helicopters, especially for the H135.” Thomas Hein, head of sales for Airbus Helicopters West Europe, said, “The H135 is a modern, modern reference for airborne rescue.”

ANWB Medical Air Assistance is wholly owned by the Royal Dutch Travel Club ANWB. It is the only helicopter emergency medical service (HEMS) operator in the Netherlands, performing more than 8,500 missions per year and operating six H135 series helicopters. Relying on helicopters, ANWB serves four trauma centers in the Netherlands 24 hours a day, seven days a week. ANWB plans to implement fleet updates with the new H135 helicopter to meet the latest technical standards. In addition, ANWB operates two H145 helicopters and works with local ambulance service providers to perform more than 600 air ambulance missions each year for the Dutch Wadden Islands.

H135 is the benchmark in the global HEMS field. It combines a spacious, barrier-free cabin with outstanding performance, range and payload capabilities, and low noise operation. The oversized sliding side door and flip-top rear door allow for quick loading and unloading of patients. At the same time, Airbus' iconic ducted tail rotor provides additional safety in ground operations.

In addition to the 4-axis autopilot, the Helionix avionics system provides an innovative cockpit layout that helps improve situational awareness. The H135 helicopter is designed with three large electronic displays, the cockpit is compatible with night vision goggles and is equipped with a first limit indicator that displays the pilot's corresponding engine gauge data in an indicator.

To date, more than 1,270 H135 series helicopters have been in operation worldwide, with a cumulative total of nearly 5 million hours of flight hours.
