In the recent delivery ceremony of Airbus’s first H135 helicopter in Qingdao, the yellow-painted helicopter made a series of actions such as acceleration, hovering, “Levisman reverse” andsteep slope, like a yellow scorpion. The dexterous posture, which also means that from 0 to 1, the general aviation industry in Qingdao officially “takes off”.

The sixth frame begins in the green assembly

Different from commercial aviation, general aviation is flexible, fast and efficient, and is a symbolic industry in aviation countries. Medical ambulances, meteorological observations, aerial inspections, aerial photography, marine surveillance, and private jets all fall into the category of general aviation.

Compared with European and American countries, China's navigation aircraft is not only a small number, but also has a gap in manufacturing. In the United States, for example, more than 250,000 general aviation aircraft are registered with the FAA (United States Federal Aviation Administration), while there are only a few thousand in the country. The general aviation industry has great potential for development and has a strong driving force for economic development and transformation and upgrading.

“The navigation industry is still in its infancy in China, which is equivalent to starting from scratch. But it also means that the entire market is very large. Some experts believe that the navigation industry is another trillion-level emerging industry.” Qingdao United General Aviation Industry Development Co., Ltd. General Manager Su Qinglin said.

Take the Airbus Qingdao H135 helicopter assembly line project undertaken by Qingdao United Airlines Co., Ltd. as an example. The project aims to meet the development goals of gathering aviation talents, integrating navigation resources, improving manufacturing level, promoting industrial agglomeration and deepening international cooperation. The construction of the ecosystem andthe establishment of the peninsula helicopter application demonstration system will carry the mission of developing the general aviation industry in Qingdao, re-engineering the Qingdao billion-dollar industrial chain, and assisting the transformation and upgrading of regional industries.

Su Qinglin introduced: "This project has filled the gap of 3 tons of navigable helicopters in China. Next we will base on the H135 assembly line to develop R&D and design upstream of the navigation industry, as well as downstream manufacturing, operation, sales, training, etc. The agglomeration effect has made the navigation industry in Qingdao andShandong bigger and stronger."

The Qingdao assembly line was jointly funded by Airbus Helicopter Company and China. It is the first H135 helicopter assembly line established by Airbus Helicopter Company outside Europe. The total investment is about 100 million Euros and a total of 100 orders are underwritten. The final assembly line will be completed and delivered by the end of this year. It is expected to be officially operated at the beginning of next year. It will maintain the same quality, the same technical level and the same service standard as the assembly line of the Danubewater base in Germany, with a design capacity of 36 units/year.

"The first five of the Airbus Qingdao H135 helicopters will be completed by the Chinese and foreign technical workers at the German base. From the sixth, they will be completely assembled in the Qingdao base." Su Qinglin said that the first batch of 20 technicians have already been in Donauworth, Germany. After more than half a year of training, I began to return and prepare for the start of the production line. There will be no problem with talents until next year.

These technicians are from Shandong and Guangzhou, Harbin, Hebei and other places. They all have experience in technical positions in aerospace, locomotive, ship and other related industries, and many have had experience in foreign training and work. According to the requirements of the Airbus Helicopter Assembly, they are located in important positions such as avionics, electrical, testing and assembly.

Layout aviation medical rescue system

The general aviation industry chain is huge, and the economic pull effect is obvious. It involves not only the development and manufacture of key components such as airborne equipment, engines and avionics equipment, but also aircraft maintenance and modification, aviation training and other projects. It can be said that the Airbus Qingdao H135 helicopter assembly line is an icebreaker in the development of the generalaviation industry in Qingdao.

But the problem of light to solve manufacturing does not mean that the plane can go to heaven and land smoothly. "Automobiles go to 4S stores and buy them at any time. Roads, parking lots, and gas stations are all ready-made. However, the navigation of helicoptersrequires airspace approval, and there are infrastructures for landing. Many conditions are not available." Su Qinglin believes that navigation The industry involves the opening of low-altitude airspace and the planning and construction of general-purpose airports. It must not only “make it out and sell it”, but also “float and fall down”.

The aviation medical rescue system in developed countries has long matured. For example, German helicopters can reach the accident site in any part of the country within 15 minutes. The annual rescue mission is more than 100,000 times. In most parts of the United States, 20-minute helicopter rescue service is guaranteed. There are 30 professional aviation medical rescue companies.The aviation medical rescue system in developed countries has long matured. For example, a German helicopter can reach an accident site in any part of the country within 15 minutes. The annual rescue mission is more than 100,000 times. In most parts of the United States, 20-minute helicopter rescue service is guaranteed. There are more than 300 professional aviation medical rescue companies. .

The breakthrough point selected by Qingdao United Airlines Co., Ltd. is also in the field of aviation medical rescue, and the demonstration system of helicopter application led by aviation medical rescue is based on Qingdao, facing Shandong and radiating the whole country. Su Qinglin told reporters: "The biggest feature of helicopters is that they have fast response speed and have advantages in special terrains such as snow mountains. We also want to learn from the mature model in Europe and America, apply medical rescue helicopters first, establish a model in Qingdao and even Shandong, and then Promoted throughout the country."

The cost of medical rescue helicopters is relatively high. Qingdao United Airlines will now seek government procurement services to support helicoptermedical rescue applications. Later, with the market growth, medical insurance and commercial insurance will be introduced, and the helicopter medical rescue operation mode applicable to China will gradually be formed. "The German medical rescue helicopter system is very mature, but they have also used it for 30 years to establish this system. We are confident to learn from foreign experience and combine our national conditions, so that the H135 helicopter made by Qingdao will fly as soon as possible, so that the people can enjoy the helicopter. Medical rescue service." Su Qinglin said.

(Machine Translated from Chinese)
Full_Article:
AIREXPO SHANGHAI0

2019 Shanghai Aerospace Equipment Exhibition

Guiding Unit Shanghai Economic and Information Commission

Exhibition Background Shanghai International Aerospace Technology and Equipment Exhibition ("Shanghai Air Show") has been successfully held for six times since its establishment in 2005. The exhibition attracted a total of thousands of civil aviation, commercial aviation, general aviation and related enterprises and industry organizations from nearly 40 countries and regions around the world. The exhibition was successfully held for several years to expand the huge scale of China's aviationmanufacturing industry. The market provides a broad platform. As the international shipping center in the forefront of the country and the world, Shanghai's aviation hub and supporting construction has been quite effective, and it has led the rapid development of the aerospace industry in East China. In order to better promote the development of China's general aviation and civil aviation industry and business aviation industry, the Shanghai Aviation Society, Gordon Commercial and related authorities and other departments are scheduled to be held at Shanghai Hongqiao-National Exhibition Center on November 14-16, 2019. 2019 The 7th Shanghai International Aerospace Technology and Equipment Exhibition. It is hoped that this event will be an international platform for the world's civil aviation, business aviation, generalaviation and aerospace professionals to build a professional and effective product andservice display, business negotiation, technical exchange and policy interpretation in China. Healthy development and international cooperation in the aerospace industry. In the same period, Shanghai International Air Service Industry Expo, International AviationEngineering Summit Forum, Commercial Aviation Engine Shanghai International Forum, Airport Construction and Development (International) Summit, Aviation Intelligent Manufacturing and Materials Innovation Shanghai International Forum, International Aviation Rescue and Fire Safety will be held. Summits, international flight trainingseminars and buyer meetings, and many other events and forums. 

After the last review , the AIREXPO SHANGHAI has been maturing with China's aerospace industry. The last exhibition attracted nearly 500 civil aviation, commercialaviation, and general aviation pioneers and institutions from 40 countries and regions around the world, with an international ratio of 41%. The aviation sector includes: China Commercial Aircraft, Shanghai Aerospace Electronics Corporation, Arcos, Czech Light Aircraft Association, DuPont China, Honeywell Aerospace Group, Italy Faimi, Italy Nass, Shanghai Hangan, Shanghai Aerospace Technology Research Institute, Shanghai Aerospace Administration, Shanghai Airport Group, Weihai Guangtai, Qiaofu Foam, Ontario and Quebec, Canada, Lower Saxony, Hamburg, Bremen, Bavaria, andSlovakia; in the aerospace sector, the moon 19 innovative product models such as Che Yutu and Fengyun No. 4 are the most eye-catching. The forum meeting at the same time of the exhibition invited well-known experts and scholars, corporate executives and first-line practitioners to hold hot discussions on the four themes of “advanced, safe, low-carbon and navigable”. The response was positive. CCTV, SMG, ICS, Xinhua News Agency, China News Service, Economic Daily, China Daily, China Industry News, Morning News, Ningxia Daily, Sina and other major domestic media also competed to report.

In the journey of thousands of miles, Shanghai International Aerospace Technology andEquipment Exhibition absorbs the essence of leading overseas technology and products, promotes the rise of “Made in China” and carries the important mission of aerospacepeople. With a long way to go, Shanghai Air Show will surely live up to expectations andcreate a beautiful future!

Concurrent events since 2005, the first Shanghai International Aerospace Technology and Equipment Exhibition, the show has gone through more than ten years, has professionals from all over the world aviation gathering in Shanghai every year, collecting market information and product updates, Seek business partners and actively participate in industry forums. In the same period, the exhibition promoted the development of aerospace technology and equipment, and enhanced the cooperation and cooperation between aviation service providers and airlines, aircraft manufacturers and airport groups. The organizer of this event, Shanghai Aviation Society, Gordon CommercialSpecial Exhibition International Aviation Engineering Summit Forum, CommercialAviation Engine Shanghai International Forum, Airport Construction and Development (International) Summit, Shanghai International Forum on Aviation Intelligent Manufacturing and Materials Innovation, International Aviation Rescue and Fire Safety Summit Forum, International Flight Training Seminar and Buying The family meets andwaits for many events and forums. It is hoped that through the combination of exhibitions and forums, the understanding and friendship between the supply and demand sides will be increased to enhance the international competitiveness and influence of the aerospace industry.

1. International Aviation Engineering Summit Forum

As one of the most important activities of the Shanghai Air Show, the International Aviation Engineering Summit will continue to invite the Civil Aviation Administration of China, the Civil Aviation Maintenance Association of China, the International AircraftEngine Association, AVIC, COMAC, Airbus, and Boeing. , Pakistan Airlines, Bombardier and major domestic and foreign airlines and enterprises attended and spoke, focusing on aviation maintenance engineering, engine maintenance technology, interior materials innovation and development, around the market analysis and development strategy of China's civil aviation maintenance industry, airlines Maintenance cost strategy selection and trends, aero-engine maintenance engineering management and risk control, optimized procurement and inventory management of repair parts and used parts, innovative design and selection of aircraft seats and materials, innovation in on-board entertainment and communication systems, aging aircraft Hot topics such as maintenance management and interior modification are discussed.

2. Shanghai Air Show Supply and Demand Matchmaking Meeting

During the exhibition, aviation manufacturers, operators, service providers, aviationengineering and services, and smart airport supply and demand matchmaking will be one of the biggest highlights of Shanghai Air Show. The event will invite materials, standard parts and airborne systems in the world. The supplier representatives andaviation manufacturers will jointly discuss future work plans, sort out and solve key anddifficult problems, coordinate and promote model development work to promote the healthy development of China's aircraft manufacturing industry, maintenance industry and airport operations. The supply and demand matchmaking meeting is mainly through one-on-one face-to-face communication between the supply and demand sides and the pragmatic and efficient professional buyers. The sample collection and information collection is directly carried out at the matchmaking meeting to promote understanding and friendship between the supply and demand sides.

The exhibition exhibits a wide range of aircraft (civil aircraft, business jets, drones, helicopters, light and small aircraft, etc.), aerospace engine design andmanufacturing, aerospace electronics and airborne equipment, aerospace information technology and intelligence, Aerospace manufacturing technology (cutting, die, die casting, laser, welding, painting and final assembly) and processing, aerospace new technologies and materials, aircraft interiors and refurbishment, aircraft airworthiness and testing equipment, aerospace metrology testing and standardization, AerospaceMaintenance and Repair Equipment; Aviation Finance and Leasing; AerospaceGeneral Tools and Equipment, Other Materials and Tools, Flight Control Instruments and Computers, Aerospace Training and Training Equipment, Aviation Rescue andFire Safety, Airport Facilities Technology and Equipment, Air cargo handling equipment and containers, special vehicles; self-service check-in system and touch technology, green airport and aviation lighting equipment, air traffic control equipment andcommand and dispatch, airport security system (special safety inspection and rescue equipment); military-civilian integration; spacecraft Design, manufacturing, satellite andground detection equipment; science Industrial park and aerospace-related technology and equipment, and many other fields.

During the exhibition, participants from the aviation, aerospace, weapons, ships, universities, research institutes, air force, navy, armed police, meteorology, surveying and mapping, environmental protection, electric power, railway, marine, civil affairs, trade industry representatives attended the exhibition and Tens of thousands of professional visitors gathered to share the aviation industry procurement event.

Heading: Airbus Future CEO - Faury
Article.Description: The current president of Airbus Civil Aircraft, Faury, will replace Thomas Enders as Airbus CEO. Currently, Enders will continue to hold the position until the April 10, 2019 Annual General Meeting of Shareholders . At that time, the appointment of Faury as an executive member of the board of directors will also be submitted to the shareholders for consideration. (Machine Translated from Chinese)
Full_Article:
Airbus Corporation board of directors selected Guillaume Faury as the company's CEO.

The current president of Airbus Civil Aircraft, Faury (50 years old), will replace Thomas Enders as Airbus CEO. Currently, Enders (59) will continue to hold the position until the April 10, 2019 Annual General Meeting of Shareholders (AGM). At that time, the appointment of Faury as an executive member of the board of directors will also be submitted to the shareholders for consideration.

Airbus CEO Thomas Enders said: "Faury? is an excellent choice. Over the years, he has held various positions within and outside Airbus and gained extensive industrial and aviation experience. With strong values With the concept of internationalization, Faury will be the representative of a new generation of leaders needed for Airbus in the next decade. I will also do my best to support him and ensure a smooth and smooth transition."

From 1998 to 2008, Faury held various senior management positions at Eurocopter , including related positions in engineering and flight testing, and subsequently became executive vice president of commercial projects and executive vice president of research and development.

In 2009, Faury joined Peugeot as a vice president of research and development and a member of the management committee. In May 2013, Faury returned to Airbus as CEO of Airbus Helicopter and served as the helm of Airbus civilian aircraft in early 2018.

Airbus Chairman of the Board of Directors Dennis Ranke said: "We are fully prepared for this succession and reached a consensus conclusion after a thorough review of all internal and external candidates. We are very happy to appoint like Faury He is at the helm of the company. His global vision, rich operational experience, strong personal values ??and straightforward leadership style make him an ideal candidate to unite the Airbus team and create value for customers, partners and shareholders.

Thanks to Enders, for nearly two decades, he has been serving Airbus with full enthusiasm and has achieved great success. The company's strategic, structural and management transformation under the leadership of Enders has made Airbus better. Follow its performance track and continue to fulfill its commitment to shareholders and the broader financial community in the future."

“I am honored to be selected by the board of directors to lead this extraordinary company. I look forward to meeting this new challenge in a passionate and enthusiastic way. The outstanding professional knowledge and professionalism of all the empty customers around the world will be my strong backing.” Fu “In the next few months, I will continue to lead the civil aircraft business and do my best to satisfy our civil aircraft customers and complete the smooth transition of the company’s management,” said Li.

Dennis Ranke will continue to serve as Chairman of the Board until the end of the April 2020 term, in line with expectations for the succession of the Board of Directors proposed at the 2016 Annual GeneralMeeting. The Board of Directors will begin to select the new chairman in due course in accordance with the principle of “maintaining the importance of internationalization and diversification of the board of directors and management” mentioned in the internal regulations.

Heading: Look Over! The Nanfang Daily Unveiled the Big Country Heavy Equipment That Debuted at the Air Show!
Article.Description: Boeing, Airbus and other world-renowned aerospace companies will also make their debut at China Air Show, especially the world's "Top 100" aerospace companies have significantly increased their participation. (Machine Translated from Chinese)
Full_Article:
From November 6th to 11th, the 12th China International Aviation and Aerospace Exhibition (hereinafter referred to as “China Air Show”) will be held at Zhuhai International Air Show Center. The reporter found out that the quality of the exhibition of this year's air show has made a major breakthrough: a number of "high, fine and sharp" exhibits representing the world's advanced level are expected to be unveiled collectively. The grades and quality of domestic exhibitors are further optimized, and the exhibit structure is realized for the first time. "Land, sea, air, sky, electricity" coverage in all areas.

The organizers of China Airshow said that this year's air show will be dedicated to demonstrating the great achievements in China's aerospace and defense science and technology fields, highlighting the new face of reform and strengthening the army, and comprehensively enhancing the internationalization, specialization, marketization, branding and information of the exhibition. Level of development.

As the “main dish” of previous air shows, the quality of exhibits in the aerospace field determines the professionalism of the air show.

In terms of aviation equipment, China Aviation Industry Corporation Limited is represented by “two types, four generations”, “20 series” and “domestic large aircraft family”. A total of 145 products will be exhibited, of which 45 will be exhibited for the first time. A number of star models such as the AG600, the New Boat 700, the AC series helicopter, and the FTC2000G (Mountain Eagle) will also be unveiled in their respective ways.

As the main body of the development of our national large aircraft, China Commercial Aircraft Co., Ltd. will display the 1:1 prototype of the CR929 long-range wide-body aircraft. The ARJ21 advanced regional passenger aircraft will perform static demonstration and demonstration flights.

China Aero-Engine Group exhibition area of nearly 30 0 square meters, will showcase include aircraft engines, gas turbines, helicopter transmission and other major aerospace products, and its ability to innovate in the design, testing, materials, manufacturing, etc. Among them, wide-body passenger aircraft engines, civil turboshaft turboprop engines, and foreign trade products developed for the international market are exhibited for the first time.

In the aerospace field, China Aerospace Science and Technology Group Co., Ltd. will bring together 184 products with the latest scientific and technological achievements in the past two years, including three major categories: aerospace systems, defense systems, aerospace technology applications and service industries.

Among them, the new generation of carrier rocket family (CZ-5, CZ-5B, CZ-6, CZ-6A, CZ-7, CZ-7A, CZ-8, CZ-11 heavy-duty launch vehicle, model 1:10) for the first time collective Debut. The space station core cabin, the 4 detector and relay star), and the large thrust pump rear swing liquid oxygen kerosene engine (physical) were also exhibited for the first time.

China Aerospace Science and Industry Corporation will focus on "building a global offensive and defensive equipment system, leading the commercial aerospace development format, sharing the "One Belt, One Road" cooperation opportunity", and systematically demonstrating the air defense system, the coastal defense system, the ground strike system, and the unmanned combat system. The overall capabilities and main products of the early warning and security system, the commercial aerospace system, the command communication and support system, and nearly 100 products for the seven systems exhibited, the scale of exhibiting is the highest ever.

Ground equipment dynamic demonstration is more abundant

With the expansion of the demonstration area, the dynamic demonstration of the ground equipment of this year's air show is more abundant. More than 30 models of Chinese weapons, Chinese military equipment, and Dongmin, Beiqi and other "People's Army" companies will perform performances such as climbing slopes, cisterns, and snake-shaped maneuvers.

In terms of land equipment, the static and dynamic exhibition area of ??Chinese weapons increased from the previous session, the number of exhibiting products reached a record high, and more than 60% of the exhibiting equipment was first publicly displayed.

Among them, the synthetic equipment model represented by synthetic forces, mountain troops, amphibious units, shore defense units, special operations units, andrapid reaction units, and the integrated military combat system, precision strike equipment system, air defense system, and coastal waters The defensive weapon system will be statically displayed; the main battle tanks, wheeled armored vehicles, crawler infantry fighting vehicles, etc., which are independently developed and manufactured, will perform ground dynamic demonstrations.

As one of the main exhibitors of land equipment, China Ordnance Equipment Group Co., Ltd. exhibited the largest scale, product quantity and technology level in this year's air show, and exhibited a total of 251 products in 6 fields. More than twice as many as the previous exhibitions, mainly including six areas of fast-resistance units, terminal defense, airborne weapons, smart ammunition, and light weapons.

In terms of electronic equipment, China Electronics Technology Group Corporation will be based on the "3+N" main business layout for the first time, with the theme of "national defense", "technology" and "electronic information", systematically exhibiting China Electronics in land, sea, air, and sky. More than 400 cutting-edge information products and solutions in many fields. Among them, the indoor exhibition area is mainly divided into three major sections: defense electronics, security electronics, and information technology. Outdoors will display a variety of large-scale installations in the technical fields of command and control, early warning detection, electronic countermeasures, and marine electronics.

China Electronic Information Industry Group Co., Ltd. has more than 30 products exhibiting, focusing on the advanced achievements of China Electronics in defense electronics, information security and public safety in various forms such as physical display, interactive experience and video materials. Application, more than 90% of the exhibits in kind.

It is worth mentioning that this year's air show will highlight the construction of the “Belt and Road” and the development of military-civilian integration. Among them, the aviation industry, aerospace science and technology, China Electric Power, etc. will highlight the important achievements of China's participation in the "Belt and Road" construction in the field of commercial aerospace and network information. The number of exhibitors of BAS, Dongfeng Off-Road, Shanxi Ketai, Tianhe Defence, etc., has increased significantly and the scale has expanded significantly.

Up to now, this year's air show has confirmed the participation of 43 countries and regions, 770 exhibitors at home and abroad, exhibiting more than 100 domestic and international aircraft, and the exhibition scale has reached a record high. The number of organizers has expanded from the last seven to 13 in this year: Guangdong Provincial People's Government, China Council for the Promotion of International Trade, People's Liberation Army Air Force, China Civil Aviation Administration, China Aviation Industry Corporation, China Commercial Aircraft Limited Liability Company, China Aerospace Science and Technology Group Co., Ltd., China Aerospace Science and Industry Group Co., Ltd., China Ordnance Industry Group Co., Ltd., China Ordnance Equipment Group Co., Ltd., China Electronics Technology Group Co., Ltd., China Aviation Engine Group Co., Ltd., China Electronic Information Industry Group Limited. The industry believes that the expansion of the organizers has further strengthened the foundation of the exhibition and provided more powerful guarantees and support for the establishment of higher-level airshows.

Among them, civil aviation system, aviation industry, China Commercial Air craf tand other units will bring more new products, new technologies, new services and new achievements to participate. The Chinese Air Force and the Army will appear on the same stage to showcase the current state-of-the-art weapons and equipment. Relevant enterprises of China's ship system will also exhibit exhibits with maritime defense exhibits. So far, the exhibit structure of China Airshow has achieved the coverage of “land, sea, air, sky and electricity” for the first time.

Boeing, Airbus and other world-renowned aerospace companies will also make their debut at China Air Show, especially the world's "Top 100" aerospace companies have significantly increased their participation. The pavilions of traditional European and American countries such as the United States, Russia, France, Canada, Italy, Ukraine, the Czech Republic, and the Netherlands continued to participate. The German and British pavilions returned strongly, and Belarus organized the first national pavilion to participate.

Air show highlights first look

Aspect 1

"Saudi Eagle" debut China Air Show

"Apollo Rolling" "Diamond Loopback" "Spiral Flying Around" "One Arrow Through Heart"... The reporter was informed that the 12th China Airshow Zhuhai Executive Committee and the Saudi Arabian Royal Air Force have recently performed "Saudi Eagle" stunts. The flight show team officially signed the contract. Together with the Pakistani Air Force "Dragon" fighters that have signed up for the exhibition, the Air Forces of China, Saudi Arabia and Pakistan will jointly show off their skills for the first time, and they will bring a wonderful visual feast.

The "Saudi Eagle" aerobatic demonstration team was established in 1998. It uses the Hawk MK65A advanced trainer and is a daily formation of 7 aircraft. The performance of the performance team is mainly divided into two parts, some of which are intensively carried out in various forms of maneuvering, ending with the iconic "painting badge" action; the other part of the formation is divided into several groups to stage the thrills for the audience. Difficult aerobatics.

The "Saudi Eagle" aerobatic demonstration team is highly skilled and well-equipped. It has toured the Middle East many times since its inception. In recent years, the airshow team has traveled to the United Kingdom, Austria, Italy, Belgium and Greece to perform, and won numerous praises.

"This time, we have fully communicated and friendly consultations with Zhuhai Airport, Zhuhai Air Traffic Control Station and Zhuhai Airshow Company on the exhibition support work, which laid a good foundation for participating in this air show. The 'Saudi Eagle' aerobatic demonstration team will Carefully prepared to offer the most entertaining and iconic flight performances to the audience," said Colonel Sood, head of the Saudi Arabian Royal Air Force's advance working group.

Watch 2

A new generation of carrier rocket family collective appearance

At this year's air show, China Aerospace Science and Technology Group Co., Ltd. will bring the latest scientific and technological achievements in the past two years, a total of 184 products will be exhibited. Among them, the new generation carrier rocket family will make its first collective appearance with the 1:10 model.

Nearly ten types of carrier rockets, independently developed by the China Academy of Launch Vehicle Technology (referred to as “Aerospace First Institute”), represented by the Long March series, not only diversified in structure and function, but also in-track accuracy and effectiveness. Key indicators such as load factor, carrying capacity and adaptability have reached international standards, and have also entered the forefront of the world in terms of frequency of transmission and success rate of launch.

Among the new generation of launch vehicle families, the Long March 11 solid launch vehicle (referred to as the "Long Eleven Rocket") is the only solid model in China's new generation of launch vehicles. In recent years, its performance has been particularly dazzling and attracting attention. Jin Xin, deputy director of the Chang 11 rocket, said that compared with the other brothers of the "Long March Family", the Chang 11 rocket is not a "big man". The diameter of the arrow is only 2 meters, but the energy contained is huge.

According to reports, since the solid fuel is filled in the rocket in advance, it can be stored for a long time, eliminating the process of fuel filling before the liquid rocket is launched, so that the preparation time of the long eleven rockets is shortened from several months to several days, and multiple pieces can be taken at one time. The satellite is sent to heaven. "This not only greatly improved the reliability of the rocket, but also further reduced the preparation for launch testing, coupled with the ability to quickly dock with a variety of satellites, so that the shortest launch preparation time of the Chang 11 rocket broke through the 24-hour mark and became the world. One of the launch vehicles with the shortest launch time," Jin Xin said.

It is worth mentioning that, previously, Zhuhai Obit Aerospace Technology Co., Ltd. developed and produced the "Zhuhai No. 1" 02 group of satellites that were "sent" into space by the Chang 11 rocket. At the beginning of this year, the Chang 11 rocket completed the "one arrow and six stars" launch mission in the first full commercial launch. In April next year, the Chang 11 rocket will conduct the first sea launch test.

At the current air show, in addition to bringing a new generation of carrier rocket family models to the audience, the First Aerospace Institute will also launch new commercial rockets at the air show site and launch a series of trades. Negotiate.

Watch 3

Three "black technology" robots debut

In addition to the new generation of carrier rocket families, the First Aerospace Institute will also showcase three robots built using space technology.

According to He Guosheng, deputy director of the Department of Business and Investment of the First Affiliation Institute, the three robots that will be unveiled are intelligent security robots, teaching robots, and industrial exoskeleton robots.

The control system is the "nerve center" of the rocket. It can make the rocket "sound" in flight, control hundreds of thousands of components to work, fly according to the scheduled route, make prescribed actions at the specified position, and can respond according to the situation. Turn and move.

Using this technology, Aerospace Institute has developed an intelligent security robot. After joining the aerospace "wisdom", this robot can autonomously avoid obstacles, state "self-detection, cloud monitoring", protect customer data and rights, and realize rapid discovery and positioning when abnormal conditions occur.

The research and development of industrial exoskeleton robots is aimed at the fields of mechanical manufacturing, express logistics operations, post-disaster emergency rescue and medical rehabilitation, etc., which have high requirements for individual operation ability but cannot use automation equipment. Aerospace First Academy researchers rely on aerospace high-power electromechanical Actuated technology and energy management technology, integrated into the lightweight and modular design concept of the aerospace system, the robot has a weight of 25 kg, which can help the operator to carry a long distance and multi-terrain walking with a load of 60 kg and a distance of 4 km per hour. operation.

The teaching robot adopts the semi-physical simulation teaching system of the loop in the loop by the system supporting robot controller, which fully satisfies the needs of the university virtual combination data analysis.

Watch 4

Main battle tank scene "show muscle"

China Ordnance Industry Group Co., Ltd. is the pioneer and leader of China's military trade. At this year's air show, China's weapons will be unveiled as the organizer, and the number of exhibiting products will reach a record high. More than 60% of the exhibiting equipment will be displayed for the first time. The technical level of the product has been further improved.

"This year's air show, China's weapons will highlight the system of weapon systems and systemized solutions." Li Zhaozhi, deputy general manager of the company's military products business department, introduced that in order to enhance the customer and professional audience's viewing experience, this year's air show China weapons will Make full use of high-tech display means such as VR, and display the all-round and three-dimensional display of the weapon industry in line with the innovations of the new military revolution in the world and all kinds of advanced weapons and equipment, both static and dynamic performances of equipment.

“The dynamic performance of ground equipment is a highlight of the last air show. The area has been expanded from the previous 70,000 square meters to nearly 110,000 square meters, and the content will be more abundant.” Li Zhaozhi introduced the main research and development of the China Ordnance Industry Group. Battle tanks, wheeled armored vehicles, crawler-type infantry fighting vehicles and other equipment will perform performances such as climbing slopes, cisterns, and snake-shaped maneuvers.

On the basis of the performance of the above projects, the dynamic demonstration will be integrated into the training scene demonstration of weapons shooting, basic tactics, equipment unloading and other courses. At that time, the air flight performance and the ground dynamic demonstration will complement each other, bringing a visual feast for the audience. .

Aspect 5

Domestic big aircraft "three brothers" are expected to gather

As the main force of the previous air show, China Aviation Industry Corporation is expected to bring more than 140 exhibits to China Air Show. More than 40 new products and technologies will be unveiled for the first time, fully demonstrating the independent development of advanced aviation equipment by China's aviation industry. Strength.

According to the exhibition plan of this year's air show, the aviation industry will push the two-type four-generation aircraft to jointly debut. The "20 Series" high-end aviation equipment, which has received worldwide attention, is expected to be publicly unveiled, and some military and trade star equipment will also be on the scene.

“The previous China Air Show has the most representative of the advanced aviation equipment developed by the group company. Starting from the ?-10 in 2008, the eagle, the -20, and the debut of the air show two years ago—20 The long-awaited aviation people's ambitions have enhanced the confidence of the Chinese people and polished the business cards of China Airshow." Tian Niu, director of the Propaganda Department of the Party Construction Department of the Aviation Industry Group, said that the aviation industry group is ready to exhibit at this year's air show. Of the more than 140 exhibits, more than 40 were first appearances. The high-tech products and technologies are sure to not disappoint the air show audience.

According to reports, the AG600, a successful amphibious aircraft that landed successfully on the land at the end of last year, is conducting experiments on water courses in an intensive manner, and strives to be able to come to the current air show site. It is expected to be a large-scale aircraft such as the large passenger aircraft C919 and the large transport aircraft. The brothers appeared together at this year's airshow.

Heading: Airbus Demonstrates Emergency Medical Service Capabilities at the International Helicopter Technology Show
Article.Description: Airbus Helicopter will present a wide range of products and digital services at the International Helicopter Technology Show in Amsterdam from October 16th to 18th, with a focus on emergency medical services  missions. (Machine Translated from Chinese)
Full_Article:
Airbus Helicopter will present a wide range of products and digital services at the International Helicopter Technology Show in Amsterdam from October 16th to 18th, with a focus on emergency medical services (EMS) missions. Thanks to long-term expertise and a wide range of professional solutions, AirbusHelicopters is a leader in the field with 60% of the in-service fleet.

At that time, the booth (8th Hall, E60 booth) will showcase an EMS-matched H145 helicopter operated by Dutch operator ANWB . With its high performance and spacious cabin, this lightweight twin-engine helicopter is one of the best-selling models for Airbus helicopters in demanding missions such as emergency medical. In addition, the helicopter is also versatile, thanks to its optional equipment and plug-and-play design concept, H145 can be quickly converted from EMS matching to other matching, performing disaster relief or mountain rescue tasks.

Visitors to the show will have the opportunity to closely observe an EMS helicopter full-size model of the EMS. The H160 features the largest cabin in its class, spacious sliding doors and slide-in stretchers. It is a new generation of intensive care helicopters for the transport of long-distance critically ill patients ormedical thermostats.

In the static display area, visitors will be fortunate to see an H175 helicopter equipped with an oil andgas mission operated by a Dutch helicopter (Heli-Holland). Currently in the oil and gas sector, there are 29 in-service H175 helicopters with a total of 40,000 flight hours. This best-selling super mid-size helicopter has been recognized by 14 oil companies worldwide and set new standards for offshore transportation.

The company will also showcase the latest Airbus options available to helicopters. Skywise is Airbus' cloud-based open data platform that stores large amounts of data from airlines, helicopteroperators, manufacturers and suppliers and turns them into actionable information to reduce operational disruption and improve security. And better predict the maintenance arrangements.

The scale model of the Racer (fast and cost-effective helicopter) technology demonstrator developed by Airbus Helicopter within the framework of Clean Sky2 will also be exhibited together to demonstrate the company's commitment to verticality for the future. The lifting solution is ready. Don't miss the opportunity to try the interactive Racer virtual experience, so you can learn more about the demonstrator's performance and future mission capabilities.

Heading: The New CEO Fires, How Does Airbus "Escape
Article.Description: Airbus said in a statement that the 50-year-old Frenchman Guillaume Faury will replace the current CEO Tom Enders from Germany at the next general meeting in April 2019. (Machine Translated from Chinese)
Full_Article:
The executives broke away from the tide and the scandals of corruption continued. After a series of successive shocks, the European aircraft manufacturing giant Airbus (hereafter referred to as Airbus) finally identified its new successor. On Monday, Airbus issued a statement saying that it will appoint its head of aircraft manufacturing business, Tom Fu Li, as the next CEO, and the turmoil that lasted for months in the leadership of Europe's largest aerospace group has come to an end. At the same time, however, the stagnation of the “discontinuation crisis” and the guise that affects delivery have always been constant. After serious internal friction, people can’t help wondering how Fu Li will clean up the mess.

01

Faury's succession is very timely. Airbus said in a statement that the 50-year-old Frenchman will replace the current CEO Tom Enders from Germany at the next general meeting in April 2019. At the end of last year, Airbus announced the departure decision of Enders, and a year before the decision was made, a Reuters report pointed out that Enders was investigated by the Austrian judicial department because of the 2003 Airbus. Airmail was allegedly "fraud and corruption" in a military aircraft order, but Airbus explicitly denied it.

The announcement shows that Fu Li will continue to address industrial technology issues affecting the delivery of some jets, while overseeing the manufacture of smaller but more autonomous helicopters and defense facilities. People familiar with the matter said that his current position will not be replaced, but this does not rule out involvement in operational management, as two top industry executives are preparing to retire at the end of this year. In addition, Airbus also announced that the company's chairman Dennis Lanke will step down in 2020, the board of directors will start to choose new in due course according to the principle of “maintaining the importance of internationalization and diversification of board andmanagement” mentioned in the internal regulations. Chairman. Some analysts believe that this means that Toray's appointment may indicate that the board of directors will undergo tremendous changes.

In fact, Fu Li's success is not just a simple appointment, which is more complicated than Enders' departure. It is understood that at the end of last year, in the power struggle with Enders, Airbus’s second-in-command chief operating officer and civil aircraft president Fabri Blyley announced that he would resign in February 2018, and then Fu Li was appointed as Head of the core aircraft manufacturing business. It was this reorganization that allowed Enders to opt out of the 2019 plan to seek a third term.

The top layer of Airbus has had problems inside. It is understood that although Enders and Blyley are important big names and second-handers in Airbus, their relationship is not harmonious. A Reuters report pointed out that Enders asked the sales team of Airbus civilian aircraft to bypass Blye directly to pay back, and this became the confirmation that Enders wanted to gain more power in the group.

The struggle between Enders and Blyley is just the tip of the iceberg in the loose upper level of Airbus. In the past September, Airbus re-announced personnel changes, saying that Eric Schultz, who served as the company's chief commercial officer for nine months, left the company for "personal reasons" and has previously served as an Airbus substation turboprop regional aircraft. Christian Scherer, head of the joint venture ATR, was immediately appointed as the successor to Eric Schultz.

02

Troublesome

Airbus seems to have fallen into the water. Not only the departure of executives, but also the management of Airbus engines, the suppliers of Airbus engines have also lost their chains. Not long ago, CFM International's LEAP series engine supply was delayed, resulting in a serious decline in the delivery of the Airbus A320neo and Boeing 737MAX series in July compared to June. On the other hand, after exposing a series of defects in the next-generation engine, Airbus has also stopped delivering the A320neo jet powered by Pratt & Whitney's turbine engine, andstopped the pre-delivery test flight after the latest technical difficulties to urge supply. Business. Airbus said that a European safety bulletin had already withdrawn the same batch of suspicious batches of aircraft containing two engines, affecting about 15-20 aircraft that were already in use.

The blessings of the blessings are not alone, and the greedy scandals that Airbus has always lingered make it exhausted. In February of this year, Airbus’s “corruption door” continued to ferment, and the German inspectorate had ordered Airbus to pay 81.25 million euros to resolve the corruption that involved the sale of typhoon fighters to Austria in 2003 during the Endes period. The settlement includes an administrative fine of 250,000 euros and a general definition by law experts of 8.8 million euros to recover the ill-gotten gains.

The giant is not so easy to get down. At the beginning of this year, Airbus released its 2017 performance report, which showed that Airbus delivered a total of 718 aircraft to 85 customers throughout the year, an increase of 4% compared to the 688 deliveries in 2016, achieving 15 consecutive years of aircraft deliveries. increase. However, it is worth noting that 2017 is the 10th anniversary of the birth of the A380, the world's largest passenger aircraft. However, due to the failure to obtain new orders, the cancellation of two existing orders has led to the "air giant". The so-called A380 once reported the risk of discontinuation. It is understood that of the 718 aircraft delivered by Airbus in 2017, there are only 15 A380 aircraft.

However, the dilemma of the A380 has a certain sense of "destiny." Zou Jianjun, a professor at the Civil Aviation Management Institute of China, analyzed in an interview with the Beijing Business Daily that the decline of the A380 was the result of changes in the operating model of aviation companies. With the advancement of technology, the long-haul routes are opening more and more. In view of the fact that more passengers tend to fly instead of transit, the traditional hub operation mode is getting weaker and weaker. "The aircraft will also be inferior, the status quo of the A380 is only a judgment of Airbus on the development trend.

03

From west to east

The Airbus in the quagmire began to look for a way out. At the beginning of this year, Airbus has revealed its willingness to establish a cooperative relationship with China in the A380 industry. At the same time, Airbus has also signed an agreement with the Chinese partner to produce the final assembly line of the Tianjin A320 series aircraft from the current monthly 4 The rack is gradually increased to six per month. In mid-September, the first Airbus A3 30 aircraft completed by the Tianjin assembly line was delivered in Tianjin.

It is understood that China currently only operates five A380s in China Southern Airlines, but according to IATA data, China will replace the United States as the world's largest aviation market by 2029. In addition, the Asia-Pacific region is the largest operating area of ??the A380. Currently, 54% of the A380 flights are departing or arriving in the Asia-Pacific region, and 18% are regional flights in the Asian region.

The potential of the Asia Pacific market has been highlighted. According to the United Nations Census and IATA data, the global “flight age” population is 4.9 billion, and by 2036 it is expected to grow by 17%, driven mainly by growth in Asia Pacific and Africa. In contrast, the “flight age” population of the aging population in Europe will fall by an average of 0.5% year-on-year. In the next 20 years, more than half of the new passengers will come from the Asia Pacific region. According to the latest report of the International Air Transport Association, by 2036, the number of new passengers in the Asia-Pacific region is expected to reach 2.1 billion, and the total market passenger traffic will reach 3.5 billion.

Airbus is attacking in all directions. In July of this year, Airbus completed the M-Series M&A deal with Canadian regional aircraft manufacturer Bombardier Aerospace and its investor Quebec Investment Company, and Airbus also acquired a controlling stake in the C-Series aircraft program. Previously, the C series was in a sales dilemma due to multiple project delays, lack of funds, and the United States' chasing and blocking. However, the addition of Airbus has caused a fundamental change in the war situation, and it has also triggered a coalition-style confrontation pattern in which the aviation manufacturing enterprises have quickly transformed from a two-pronged and two-pronged pattern.

Airbus teamed up with Bombardier to increase the likelihood of their respective rivals Boeing and Embraer. Also in July, Boeing and Embraer announced the signing of a memorandum industry, to be jointly set up a valuation of 47 Meiyuan 450 million joint venture, including civilian aircraft and industrial services sectors PIA's. Under the terms of the agreement, Boeing will own 80% of the joint venture company, and Embraer will own the remaining 20%. The original balance of the passenger aircraft market has been broken, and how Fu Li stands up to this class also makes people look forward to more.

At the same time, Airbus's contest with its biggest competitor, Boeing, is also continuing. In the 2017 order battle, Airbus achieved a brilliant five-game winning streak, but the order was not the only factor to measure an aircraft manufacturer. In the higher-priced wide-body airliner order, Boeing 159:46 The big score easily defeated Airbus. In June of this year, Boeing has already reached the Indian market in order to cut Airbus's latest wide-body passenger aircraft A3 30 neo sales. It is important to know that the Indian market is regarded by Airbus, a European aircraft manufacturer, as a crucial stop for the expansion of this aircraft sales business to Asia. At that time, the media revealed that Vistara, a joint venture between Singapore Airlines and India's Tata Group, did not choose Airbus's model, but chose Boeing 787 directly. According to reports, the Airbus aircraft, together with the larger A350 aircraft, was designed to compete with the Boeing Dreamliner.

Heading: China Eyes City Airbus, With Test Flight Planned for This Year
Article.Description: Airbus Helicopters will test-fly what it calls the City Airbus, a multi-passenger, self-piloted eVTOL vehicle designed for urban air transportation. Battery-powered, the City-Airbus will be able to take off vertically and land just about anywhere in an urban environment.
Full_Article:
Sometime toward the end of this year, Airbus Helicopters will test-fly what it calls the CityAirbus, a multi-passenger, self-piloted eVTOL (electric vertical takeoff and landing) vehicle designed for urban air transportation.

Battery-powered, the City-Airbus will be able to take off vertically and land just about anywhere in an urban environment. According to its developers, it will go a long way to easing city traffic congestion.

It is designed to carry up to four passengers over congested megacities to important destinations such as airports or railway stations in a fast, affordable and environmentally friendly way.

Airbus, one of the world's leading commercial aircraft manufacturers, said the innovative four-ducted propeller configuration significantly contributes to safety and low noise.

Marius Bebesel, CityAirbus' chief engineer, said, "We now have a better understanding of the performance of CityAirbus' innovative electric propulsion system, which we will continue to mature through rigorous testing while beginning the assembly of the full-scale City-Airbus flight demonstrator."

The first studies on the City-Airbus started in 2015.

"We were watching the rapid change in all areas driven by digitalization and new technologies such as electric propulsion, autonomous vehicles and others," Bebesel said.

"We investigated how the way people travel could be affected (by these developments) and discovered the area of urban air mobility," he said.

"We came to the conclusion that eVTOL could be a key to future mobility in an urban environment."

Bebesel said he expected the first flight to take place sometime toward the end of this year, probably in December.

"At the same time, we are working with aviation authorities to set up regulation for the certification of such vehicles and urban air mobility air traffic management. Such regulations are not in place today."

While Airbus Helicopters is just one of many companies working on flying vehicles, Bebesel said several countries are showing a keen interest in this project, although he declined to name them.

Meanwhile, it is understood that China, as well as watching developments in its domestic industry, is paying attention to the CityAirbus.

China is one of the world's largest operators of Airbus commercial aircraft, and the European giant has a number of joint ventures with aircraft companies in the country.

Bebesel said the CityAirbus is designed to ease ground congestion, especially in cities burdened with heavy traffic as urban populations continue to expand.

"CityAirbus is a multi-passenger, self-piloted, battery-powered, vertical takeoff and landing vehicle designed to carry up to four passengers on fixed routes over congested megacities in a fast, affordable and environmentally friendly way," he said.

Asked whether flying vehicles are simply solving one problem while creating another in the air, he said, "We don't expect such a huge number of aerial vehicles to be operated."

As to who would control the airspace that flying vehicles eventually operate in, Bebesel said: "This is one of the questions which still have to be worked out with all involved parties. Different solutions in different parts of the world are likely.

"Safety, however, is of utmost importance for each aerial vehicle. Being a manufacturer of aircraft for more than five decades, we have a long track record in providing safe solutions."

The CityAirbus is designed for a cruising speed of 120 kilometers per hour, with a typical one-way flight lasting about 15 minutes, or about 30 km.

"This is sufficient for reaching important spots in an urban environment," Bebesel said.

Heading: A Helicopter Crashed Into the River in Oyrkutsk, With 2 People
Article.Description: According to the Russian satellite network, the Russian Ministry of Emergency Situations said that a Robinson helicopter in the Bodebo district of Irkutsk region fell into the Vidim River. (Machine Translated from Chinese)
Full_Article:
According to the Russian satellite network, the Russian Ministry of Emergency Situations said that a Robinson helicopter in the Bodebo district of Irkutsk region fell into the Vidim River.

The mayor of Bodebo told the satellite news agency that there are two people on the helicopter, namely pilots and mechanics. He also said that the helicopter belongs to a gold mining company and is a private helicopter.

The representative of the Ministry of Emergency Situations stated that the helicopter was located at a depth of 11 meters under water.

The weather around Bodebo is changeable, cloudy and with sleet. The Ministry of Emergency Situations has started search and rescue work.

Article.Description: But FAA experts do, at times, come to different conclusions than EASA, and those agencies cede to the jurisdiction of national civil aviation authorities. Heading: Air Force Starts Training Pilots to Fly US-Made Heavy-Lift Helicopters

Heading: Airbus Puts a Luxury Spin on VIP Helicopters
Article.Description: A large portion of Airbus’s rotorcraft—helicopters, to you and me—are dedicated to rescue, utility, or transport missions, and while some are speedy, few are used for racing or recreation. In general, they’re purchased in a business-to-business context, with no differences for private and business buyers. Finally, you can customize your chopper with almost any amenity imaginable.

Both helicopters will be used to fly to and from superyachts in the Mediterranean and Caribbean on behalf of the owner.

Heading: Wiking Adds Another H145 to Its Fleet
Article.Description: Wiking Helikopter Service has taken delivery of another Airbus H145 helicopter in offshore configuration. This brings the company’s H145 fleet to a total of five aircraft, after initial deliveries of two helicopters in 2016 and 2017 and two leased H145s. It continues the successful story of Wiking in the offshore industry with the H145 being a quickly adaptable helicopter type for numerous missions.

Heading: Sikorsky Dedicates Stratford Hangar to Sergei Sikorsky
Article.Description: “Every helicopter that comes off our final assembly line will now leave this hangar under the name, Sergei I. Sikorsky,” said Dan Schultz, Sikorsky’s president. “Sergei’s commitment to our company continues to this day and has been an amazing example of passion for our products, customers and rotorcraft innovation.”

Heading: France Accelerates Joint Light Helicopter Program, Names H160M �Gu�pard�
Article.Description: The French Armed Forces have accelerated their acquisition timeline for its Hélicoptère Interarmées Léger, or joint light helicopter, program now scheduled to launch in 2021, according to Armed Forces Minister Florence Parly. The HIL aircraft, for which Airbus Helicopters’ H160M was selected in 2017, is now slated to be operational by 2026.

Heading: Italian Judge Orders Trial of Leonardo Employees in 2015 Crash of AW609 Prototype
Article.Description: As the Federal Aviation Administration and the European Aviation Safety Agency consider certification of the AW609 civil tiltrotor this year, an Italian judge has ordered the trial for several Leonardo employees in the Oct. 30, 2015 crash of a prototype AW609, according to the latest Leonardo quarterly financial report.

Heading: Leonardo Speeding Toward 2019 AW609 Certification in Philadelphia
Article.Description: Leonardo Helicopters is barreling full-tilt into flight testing of the AW609 in preparation for certification in Europe and the U.S. this year, but weather delays and a monthlong U.S. federal government shutdown have presented difficulties. The final prototype 609 tiltrotor is on the company’s assembly line here, where it also builds the AW139.

Heading: AIRBUS 50: How Airbus Helicopters Maintained Lift
Article.Description: Like much of the aeronautical industry, the slow evolution of Airbus Helicopters can be traced back to the early days of powered flight. Pioneering companies across both France and Germany slowly merged and coalesced – sometimes through pure economic decisions, sometimes with state direction – eventually transforming into a single entity.

Heading: EASA Calls for AS350/EC130 Fuel System Mods
Article.Description: The European Union Aviation Safety Agency issued Safety Information Bulletin 2017-18R1, recommending that operators of Airbus AS350/EC130 helicopters install crash-resistant fuel systems. EASA said any such approved modifications to in-service aircraft “will reduce the risk of post-crash fires and contribute to increas[ing] the occupant escape time after a survivable crash.” Several FAA- and EASA-approved STC’d fuel system mods are readily available.
Full_Article: The European Union Aviation Safety Agency issued Safety Information Bulletin 2017-18R1, recommending that operators of Airbus AS350/EC130 helicopters install crash-resistant fuel systems. Heading: Sikorsky Offers CH-53K to German Air Force
Article.Description: Sikorsky has formally offered the CH-53K King Stallion as the German Luftwaffe’s next heavy lift helicopter. A formal request for proposals for the "Schwerer Transporthubschrauber" program is expected this summer to replace the older CH-53 the German Air Force currently flies. Boeing’s CH-47F is another expected competitor for the program.

Heading: Missouri Veterans Home Marks Memorial Day; Huey Helicopter Gives Residents Rides
Article.Description: Missouri Veterans Home and the Mexico community marked Memorial Day with a special ceremony Monday. Veterans and others also had an opportunity to take rides Sunday in a UH1-B Huey helicopter that was brought to the home for Monday’s service. Administrator Brenda Ezell welcomed the audience of veterans, family and community members by giving the history of the holiday. Memorial Day has been celebrated for more than 150 years.

Heading: Japan Plans to Deploy U.S. Military Osprey Aircraft Temporarily Near Tokyo Amid Residents' Oppositions
Article.Description: Japan's Defense Minister Takeshi Iwaya said Friday that he wants to deploy on a temporary basis the U.S. military's Osprey transport aircraft to a Self-Defense Force base in Kisarazu City, near Tokyo, in March of the next year at the earliest. The Defense Ministry plans to deploy a total of 17 Ospreys for use by the Ground Self-Defense Force by 2021.

Heading: Pilotless Electric Flying Taxis Are Coming to Singapore
Article.Description: The idea of futuristic flying cabs that carry passengers short distances over urban areas is definitely picking up steam. Dozens of companies — including Boeing, Airbus and Uber — are working on eVTOL prototypes as a way to alleviate traffic and pollution in congested cities. But it looks like the first company to achieve liftoff with a commercial eVTOL service may be German air-taxi startup Volocopter.

Heading: France Speeds up Joint Light Helicopter Program
Article.Description: The French Armed Forces will get the first of their 169 H160M light helicopters two years ahead of schedule, Armed Forces Minister Florence Parly announced Monday during a visit to Airbus Helicopters’ headquarters in Marignane, France. The helicopter, which will be designated as “Guépard”/"cheetah", is now scheduled to be operational in the army, navy and air force by 2026, with a procurement program launched in 2021, a year earlier than planned in the current 2019-2025 military program law.

Heading: Leonardo Could Seek Tie-Ups in Specific Business Areas: CEO

Heading: Congress Adds to Pentagon�s Request for Key CT-Made Defense Programs
Article.Description: Congress has begun work on the Pentagon’s 2020 budget, approving an increase in spending on many of the weapons programs that are made in Connecticut. The panel also approved $807.9 Million for six CH-53K “King Stallion” helicopters, which are made by Sikorsky, and more than $72 Million to build a new pier at Naval Submarine Base New London.
Full_Article: Congress has begun work on the Pentagon’s 2020 budget, approving an increase in spending on many of the weapons programs that are made in Connecticut. The panel also approved $807.9 Million for six CH-53K “King Stallion” helicopters, which are made by Sikorsky, and more than $72 Million to build a new pier at Naval Submarine Base New London.

Heading: Senate Panel Green-Lights More Money for Army Helos, New Auto Rifle
Article.Description: The panel's draft $750 Billion Pentagon spending bill authorizes $806.8 Million for 48 AH-64E remanufactured Apache helicopters plus $105 Million for three new-build Apaches -- three more than the Army requested, according to the executive summary of the committee's Fiscal 2020 National Defense Authorization Act.
Full_Article: The panel's draft $750 Billion Pentagon spending bill authorizes $806.8 Million for 48 AH-64E remanufactured Apache helicopters plus $105 Million for three new-build Apaches -- three more than the Army requested, according to the executive summary of the committee's Fiscal 2020 National Defense Authorization Act.

Heading: Additive Manufacturing Speeds Wind Tunnel Model Creation
Article.Description: Leonardo’s helicopter division needed a 1:8.5 scale model of its new AW609 tiltrotor aircraft for a series of dedicated low-speed tests at standard flight attitudes, to be performed at the company’s own wind tunnel as well as at a facility at the Politecnical di Milano. Further, engineers wanted the freedom to quickly change the model’s external geometries to understand its aerodynamics.
Full_Article: Leonardo’s helicopter division needed a 1:8.5 scale model of its new AW609 tiltrotor aircraft for a series of dedicated low-speed tests at standard flight attitudes, to be performed at the company’s own wind tunnel as well as at a facility at the Politecnical di Milano. Further, engineers wanted the freedom to quickly change the model’s external geometries to understand its aerodynamics.

Heading: Damaged Police Chopper to Be Inspected in US
Article.Description: The police helicopter that was damaged in February during takeoff is being sent to the United States for an assessment on the extent and nature of repairs that need to be made on the vehicle. The EC135 helicopter was wrapped and delivered to the port on Tuesday to be shipped to Houston, and then to Louisiana for the assessment at an approved repair station with the manufacturer, Airbus.
Full_Article: The police helicopter that was damaged in February during takeoff is being sent to the United States for an assessment on the extent and nature of repairs that need to be made on the vehicle. The EC135 helicopter was wrapped and delivered to the port on Tuesday to be shipped to Houston, and then to Louisiana for the assessment at an approved repair station with the manufacturer, Airbus.

Heading: Airbus Shares 'Alpha Two' Flying Taxis Cockpit Photos
Article.Description: As part of Airbus best-known project - Vahana - the company's flying taxi called the Alpha Two took to the skies last January for the first time passing its initial flight test. Now, get ready for the ride as a glimpse of what the Alpha Two would look like comes out. Airbus’ Vahana Team have shared photos of Airbus flying taxi through their official blog.
Full_Article: As part of Airbus best-known project - Vahana - the company's flying taxi called the Alpha Two took to the skies last January for the first time passing its initial flight test. Heading: Boeing to Upgrade AH-64 Apache Attack Helicopter Flight Simulators to Match Capabilities of Latest Aircraft
Article.Description: Army asks Boeing to upgrade AH-64 Apache flight simulators to match the capabilities of the latest AH-64D and AH-64E attack helicopter capabilities. Military experts at the Boeing Co. will upgrade transportable flight simulators for the U.S. Army AH-64D and AH-64E Apache Longbow helicopter to make these flight trainers compatible with the latest versions of the Apache helicopter fleet.
Full_Article: Army asks Boeing to upgrade AH-64 Apache flight simulators to match the capabilities of the latest AH-64D and AH-64E attack helicopter capabilities. Military experts at the Boeing Co. will upgrade transportable flight simulators for the U.S. Army AH-64D and AH-64E Apache Longbow helicopter to make these flight trainers compatible with the latest versions of the Apache helicopter fleet.

Heading: Additional AH-64Es, UH-60Vs Advised by SASC
Article.Description: The Boeing AH-64E attack helicopter and the Sikorsky UH-60V are the two prominent rotorcraft plus-ups in the Senate Armed Services Committee's version of the fiscal 2020 National Defense Authorization Bill, S. 1215. In addition to the 48 re-manufactured AH-64D to AH-64E models requested by the U.S. Army, the SASC mark-up recommends $105 Million extra for three new build AH-64E Apache Guardians.
Full_Article: The Boeing AH-64E attack helicopter and the Sikorsky UH-60V are the two prominent rotorcraft plus-ups in the Senate Armed Services Committee's version of the fiscal 2020 National Defense Authorization Bill, S. 1215. Heading: Arrow Aviation Appointed as Leonardo Excellent Service Center
Article.Description: Arrow Aviation Company, LLC of Broussard, Louisiana, was recently appointed as a Leonardo Excellent Service Center, and is now the only Excellent Service Center in the Western Hemisphere — not including Leonardo’s own facilities in Philadelphia and Brazil. Arrow Aviation has also expanded its capabilities to include the A109E/S/SP models to its existing AW119 and AW139 capabilities.

Heading: These Secret Helicopters Were Flown by a Shadowy Unit During the Battle of Mogadishu
Article.Description: The OH-58Ds were officially part of Falcon Brigade, but had been “chopped” to the special operations force after its arrival in the country. The Kiowa Warrior in the picture has its own batwing satcom antenna, a feature that was not found on standard Army versions of this helicopter, indicating that this was added during the deployment to link it to the task force’s communications and data networks.

Heading: U.S. Army Seeks Accelerated Fielding Of Next-Generation Rotorcraft
Article.Description: The Army is seeking funds in fiscal 2020 to continue flight-testing the Bell V-280 Valor advanced tiltrotor and Sikorsky/Boeing SB-1 Defiant coaxial rigid-rotor compound helicopter under the JMR TD to close the gap. It also is seeking to accelerate FLRAA so as to deliver aircraft no later than 2030.

Heading: HUBI-FLY Signs for the Bell 505 Helicopter
Article.Description: Bell Helicopter has signed a new purchase agreement for the Bell 505 Jet Ranger X with HUBI-FLY of Austria, the company announced on 21 May. The Bell 505 Jet Ranger X is a five-seat, single-engine turbine helicopter capable of performing a wide range of missions. The new Mecaer Aviation Bell 505 VIP MAGnificent interior includes a variety of materials and seating configurations. It offers multiple storage consoles and trim options.

Article.Description: Bell’s V-280 Valor has completed flight demonstrations of its low-speed agility key performance parameter. This means the aircraft is one step closer in the contest for a contract with the U.S. Army. The flight testing shows that Bell can engineer and build an aircraft that meets Army performance requirements.

Heading: Boeing to Flight Test CH-47 With Same Monster Engines Found on Sikorsky's New CH-53K
Article.Description: Boeing says that it will begin flight tests of a CH-47 Chinook equipped with more powerful General Electric T408 engines, the same ones that the U.S. Marine Corps’ future Sikorsky CH-53K King Stallions will use. The announcement comes amid a series of new delays in the troubled King Stallion program and a Congressionally mandated review of whether an alternative helicopter, such as the Chinook, might be able to meet Marine requirements instead.

Heading: SPAES Installs Garmin Radar Altimeter on Airbus AS350
Article.Description: SPAES GmbH & Co. KG has installed a Garmin radar altimeter with the most modern technology on an Airbus AS350 helicopter. Heading: Bristow Nigeria Increases Fleet Size

Heading: Former Leonardo CEO Gets Final Acquittal in Helicopter Kickback Case
Article.Description: A former CEO of Italy’s Leonardo and a former fellow manager were given a final and definitive acquittal by Italy’s highest court on Wednesday in a bribery case dating back to the sale of helicopters to India in 2010. The high court’s decision Wednesday to back the acquittals, citing a lack of proof, means no further appeals can be requested.

Heading: Airbus Shares a Glimpse of Its Flying Taxi Cockpit
Article.Description: Airbus has been working on its Vahana project for years. It's an attempt to create an autonomous passenger drone network that could operate like a flying version of the Waymo's self-driving cars. In January, the company's flying taxi took to the skies for the first time. Now we're getting a glimpse of what the cockpit might look like. In a blog post, the Airbus Vahana team shared photos of Alpha Two -- its first demonstrator with a finished interior.

Heading: Pilot Walks Away From Powerline Collision Unscathed

Heading: Sentara Nightingale Air Ambulance Moves to the Roof, Adopts IFR Routes
Article.Description: Sentara Nightingale Regional Air Ambulance transitioned from its original ground helipad to a rooftop array 296 feet above grade on May 1, 2019. The Nightingale program has been in operation since February 1982 and currently operates an IFR-capable 2011 Airbus EC145.

Heading: Transferring Attack Helicopters to Army, a Case of Duplication of Assets and Effort?
Article.Description: Much has been made of the IAF taking delivery of the first of twenty-two Boeing AH-64E (I) attack helicopters last week. This is a narrow view that sees helicopters as only an extension of warfare on the ground, and also overestimates the Army’s ability to absorb and maximise utility of these expensive military assets.

Heading: Upgrading Our Military�s Heavy Vertical Lift Capability
Article.Description: It is time to upgrade our military's heavy-lift helicopter capabilities. The current workhorse, the CH-47 Chinook, has served our country since 1962. Despite its age, the Chinook is still the most capable heavy lift helicopter on the planet — flying at almost 200 miles per hour which is roughly the speed that the Army wants its next-generation Scout aircraft to fly. Our allies use the Chinook as well — precisely because of its utility and capability.

Heading: US Navy Awards Sikorsky Contract for 12 CH-53K Helicopters
Article.Description: The US Navy on 17 May awarded Sikorsky a USD1.1 Billion contract to build 12 production US Marine Corps CH-53K King Stallion heavy-lift helicopters. Bill Falk, Sikorsky CH-53K programme director, said on 20 May that first deliveries under this contract will begin in 2022. (Subscription Required)

Heading: Bell�s V-280 Tiltrotor Achieves Low-Speed Agility Goal
Article.Description: Bell has achieved Level 1 handling qualities with the V-280 Valor, demonstrating that the advanced tiltrotor has low-speed agility that matches or betters that of the Sikorsky UH-60 Black Hawk helicopter. Demonstrating that a tiltrotor could have the affordability and low-speed maneuverability to perform the UH-60’s utility mission is key to unlocking the potential to replace the U.S. Army’s Black Hawk fleet with a rotorcraft that has twice the speed and twice the range.

Heading: Air Force Says It Has Successfully Shot Down Multiple Missiles Using a Laser Prototype

The Navy has also been developing its own systems to be mounted on warships, where they could potentially take on threats like missiles or small boats.

The APKWS laser-guided precision munition can fit aboard the U.S. Marine Corps UH-1Y, AH-1W, and AH-1Z helicopters, the experimental Bell 407GT helicopter, the U.S. Army AH-64 Apache attack helicopter, the Eurocopter Tiger, and the Navy MH-60 Seahawk helicopter.

Heading: The Scary Moment an EC145 Helicopter Hit the Power Lines During Winching Rescue Operation
Article.Description: A Eurocopter EC145 of Sécurité Civile, the civil protection branch of the French Government, hit the power lines during a rescue operation: the helicopter, registration F-ZBQK, callsign “Dragon 972”, had just winched up a person from the sea, some 200 meters from the shore. With the rescuer and a person hanging on the winch some 5 meters below, the helicopter flew into the coastal power lines.

Heading: Warfighters Need a New �Tested� Helicopter Engine
Article.Description: The Army began funding development of a new engine for the Black Hawk and Apache more than ten years ago, even as it pursued the Future Vertical Lift program to replace both of these aircraft. It was clear that regardless of the success of the FVL program, these existing helicopters would continue in operation for decades to come. Since they were first deployed, both the Black Hawk and Apache have gained weight, which made them slower and put increased strain on their T700 engines.
